If you don't plan to do trails, white water rafting or other activities there is not much more to see in the Grand Teton. Regardless, the natural beauty of the park was amazing. The Grand Teton and Mount Moran were visible from almost anywhere and the views were all spectacular. The winding Snake River "followed" us all the way to Idaho Falls.We stopped by the Teton Village which has many high-end mountain resorts. The road from the Moose Entrance to the Teton Village (Moose Wilson Road) was long and a bit rough (unpaved in some sections); thankfully my tires were OK.Overall, this is a great national park and worth the visit.
review_title: Beautiful mountains and Snake River, and not much more

review_body: Don't just drive through here on your way to Yellowstone! The views are spectacular, especially when mirrored in one of the beautiful lakes. Wildlife abounds and I saw moose, coyote, deer, etc.

For anyone who has not seen the beauty that is contained within the Grand Teton National Park, your life is incomplete. Scenic, beautiful hiking trails and wildlife made this the best trip I have taken this year.

I have been to several National Parks, but these majestic mountains seems to follow you wherever you went. They are beautiful to see from the water, taking them in during a hike or just sitting at the Jackson Lake Lodge with a glass of wine and enjoying nature at its best. Not to be missed!

Grand Teton was my husbands' and my favorite of the four National Parks we visited on our recent trip. We liked the variation of scenery throughout the park and this is the park where we saw the most large animals. The area around Jenny Lake is amazing and there is a very nice hike once you take the shuttle boat across the lake.

Grand Teton National Park is beautiful with its dominating mountains in the background. To truly enjoy this park one cannot just drive through it you have to get off the beaten path, but that is difficult to do in just a day or two. We enjoyed some side roads not just the north south route like Mormon Row where we saw settlers cabins and barns and the much photographed Moulton Barn with the backdrop of the Tetons. We were lucky to photograph a Black Bear enjoying berries, a small group of Pronghorn antelope, Bison, Mountain Bluebirds and an Osprey fishing. Jackson and Jenny Lakes are beautiful and we enjoyed a picnic on the shore of Jenny Lake all the while marveling at the beauty surrounding us and we were visited by several Gray Jays. Although the Berry Fire between Grand Teton and Yellowstone was in progress we had clear, beautiful skies during our visit. A photographer's dream. If you have a limited amount of time and want an experience of the park without paying the entrance fees you can drive from Jackson, Wyoming north on Route/89/191/26 and go as far north as Moran Junction without entering the park.

There's a main strip that runs north and south along the range. Take that up and back and you've pretty much seen the Grand Tetons. It's a row of mountains. There are a lot of turnouts that allow you to view the mountains at different angles and some include lakes and a river. Good picture opportunities but once you see them from the main road then you won't see anything that surpasses that. Worth a visit but I'd keep it to a day at the most.

Pick this national park because it was close to Yellowstone. Rich in history and amazing views of the mountains. We stayed in the Teton Villages so easy to spend our days sightseeing the area. I would recommend the park for anyone that enjoys our National Parks
Every direction was gorgeous.. especially from Grand Teton viewing spot..looking at Teton the color was granite..but take a picture and Teton turns snow white..amazing.

Went to GTP in September. Was a bit concerned about smoke and haze from the Yellowstone fires, but had no problems. GTP is fairly compact compared to Yellowstone, so it's easy to do a lot of different things without an insane amount of driving.

This park was pretty. You just drive through and enjoy the beauty. We went in early Sept 2016. We didn't see as much wildlife as we expected, but the sprawling fields and the beauty of the mountains made up for the lack of wildlife. We entered from Yellowstone National Park and made our way down to Jackson Hole. I wish we skipped Jackson Hole (tourist trap) and stayed at the park.
I enjoyed Teton Park. The mountains are amazing. Everywhere you walk or go you'll have a perfect view of the Mountains. Surrounded by beauty.

This the sub range of the Rockies and towers over the rest in the vicinity, we drove from the entry of the national park through semi sealed/loose gravel road for about 8 miles through the forest before heading towards yellowstone and loved it

This park is a national treasure! Visit if you can and bring the whole family. There are hiking trails, biking paths, lakes, rivers, campsites and luxury hotels - something for everyone if you enjoy the great outdoors!

Great to see them at Transfiguration Chapel and Mormon Row Barn and Signal Mt. Also stopped at String Lake. Had a great Dinner at Bar J Cowboy Dinner at Wilson. The harmony of the Bar J Wranglers was great and very close. Also funny at times. There are many pull overs to see the Mt.'s. Can see buffalo and antelope

1Really enjoyed hiking to inspiration point. You walk around Jenny Lake and ascend to beautiful point. All along the way there are various falls and gorgeous lake views. So glad we got there VERY early. There is lots of parking and a large visitor center. So, unless you want to have lots of company, go early! For those wanting to shorten their hike, you can take a boat across the lake or take the boat back to the parking area. $9.00 each way.2. Went to the Laurence Rockefeller Preserve and really loved hiking to Phelps lake. Saw a beautiful baby bar climbing a tree on the way in, from the car. 3.Enjoyed hiking to Taggart Lake and also Bradley. Moderate elevation. Very beautiful views. Saw a beautiful mountain deer or elk keeping us company part of the way.Eat at Dornans for lunch-- excellent, original, and just so authentic. Great food too. The have a bbq and a deli where you can get sandwiches or picnic supplies.
Great experience at this gigantic mountain range with lovely peaks and a breathtaking scene. Drive from Utah side was wonderful through mountains and valleys and green fields . WoW!!
The first time we only drove through this National Park, a few weeks ago we enjoyed more of its beauty. What a beauty to see and explore, mountains, lakes, animals.... Want to go back.

Words cannot even describe how amazing the views were when driving through the park. We did the loop and stopped at every pull off because each one offered it's own unique view. Can't wait to come back!!!!

We stayed at Teton Village, checked in our accommodation and as it was early evening decided to drive the Moose/Wilson road as its good for Wildlife sightings, we stopped at a pullout about five miles up and saw a Black Bear Sow and two cubs, couldn't believe our luck. After the bear encounter travelled up to Mormon Row to get a glimpse of the old barns. Just felt that this was a highlight of a months road trip, Grand Teton didn't disappoint. The next day I got my photo of the Snake River with the Tetons behind. Certainly lived the dream here!
If the weather is good, the Teton mountain range is very photogenic. If visiting Jackson, well worth a day out.

Our tour group departed Yellowstone National Park and drove along the Snake River and through Grand Teton National Park on our way to Jackson, WY. We made several photo stops and enjoyed a Snake River float trip as we viewed the majestic Gran Teton range. This was truly one of the highlights of our 8 day tour - we captured memories that will be with us forever.
So awesome to see these majestic mountains. They are truly scenic and I'm glad to have been a visitor for a short time.
The Grand Teton combined with the Snake River makes a gorgeous scenery. We took the scenic route and stopped numerous times to enjoy the scenery. There are many photos ops.

Stare in awe and wonder at the Tetons. We drove through after going to Yellowstone and it was beautiful. Geologists, nature lovers, or anyone with an eye for natural beauty would enjoy this park. My one regret is not camping there over night.

We visited Grand Teton just as a passing visit when driving from Yellowstone NP to Salt Lake City. On our visit we entered from Yellowstone's South entrance where no passes were checked and no maps were handed out. From what we saw the park itself was very beautiful with some fantastic views. We visited an abandoned Mormon village whist travelling through which was very interesting and I would recommend. If you are travelling between Yellowstone and Salt Lake City in a day I don't think I would recommend going through Grand Teton NP as it added a lot of time onto the journey and we didn't have much time to stop at the view points, which just lead to disappointment.
review_title: Wish we could have had a longer visit

review_body: Grand Teton doesn't offer as many active attractions but it does offer breath taking views. I couldn't stop taking pictures of the Tetons because they are so beautiful! Definately helps you appreciate the beauty of our land!

The valley of Jackson Hole has over 56 miles of paved bike trails and one of them is the grand loop past Teton Village and through the Grand Teton National Park via Moose. It absolutely gorgeous, can't put it any other way. Don't drive if you can avoid it, your experience of the National Park will much more special on a bike.

My family and I camped here many times when we lived in Idaho Falls years ago. I spread my husband's ashes in sight of the Grand Teton and the Snake River five years ago, so I was revisiting the area on a memory trip and to show my respects.

We visited Grand Teton NP on our way to Yellowstone. I'd allowed a full day, but really wished we'd have spent longer exploring. The sights are amazing, breathtaking scenery, and plenty of other hikes and activities. We could have sat on the shore of Jenny Lake for hours admiring the view. A must visit in its own right, but a combination with Yellowstone NP makes for a truly amazing holiday!
Incredible National Park. Great hiking trails and beautiful lakes. The views of the range are awe inspiring. Be sure to visit.

The little sister of Yellowstone National Park, Grand Tetons is in my opinion the more beautiful of the two. The mountain range is so majestic and the roads through the park are an endless route of of the proof of God's artistic ability.

Unless you want to get into the back country with the bears, this is more a "look and see" NP than some others but there are still some interesting hikes. We went to Jenny Lake (despite the warnings about the parking - and there were some works going on in the car park that restricted it a bit - there is quite a lot there) and took the short (and expensive for what it was) but enjoyable boat ride across the lake so we could concentrate on the hike into the canyon. That was well worth doing and you can walk pretty much as far as you like. The second day we drove along Hwy 191 and explored the scenic turnouts. We tried to get into the car park for the Laurance Rockefeller centre as we also wanted to do a hike from there but there was a queue. Later we returned and were glad we did as it is a very interesting centre. More an art installation than a visitor centre!

We dedicated 3 days to check out Grand Teton after spending 3 days in Yellowstone and were glad we did. So many things to see here, and the roads were much better than Yellowstone. Make sure to check out Inspiration Point and Jackson Lake, plus do the 'scenic loop' drive, and be ready to stop and take pictures...
review_title: One of the Best National Parks!

review_body: I've hiked a great deal in many states, and I've seldom come across such useless maps or lackluster signs out in the trails. We ended up doing a whole extra mile on a 9.5 mile hike because the signs were either not there or unintelligible.The land itself is stunning, but moving through it is challenging. There are no short day hikes to the Tetons. Hikes were between 13 and 20 miles to the Tetons.We stayed at Lizard Lake Campground, which was cheap and alright for a basic campground. The trash can was hard to find and the rules were a bit unique/demanding.

The Grand Teton National Park is close to Yellowstone National Park, and is, for most people, overshadowed by it. However, I found Grand Teton spectacular -- really pristine and majestic. There are many activities here. I went for a two-horse horseback ride. That was great fun. There is also a variety of lodging and eatery choices in the park.

That is the pace I want to go there again, so beautiful. We stayed there for 3 days, the last day morning had a heavy fog in the morning, but later fog suddenly disappear, the view is amazing. so many photograph there for shooting nice photos
review_title: The place I want to go there again

review_body: I've been to so many National Parks, but none really match the epic beauty of Grand Teton!!!Great hikes for all levels and the soaring mountains can be seen from everywhere while driving too.
review_title: America's Best Idea - our National Parks!!

review_body: This little church is a must do, over everything else in my opinion. Its almost one hundred years old and welcomes everyone, doors always open. I generally stop by a couple times during the course of my trips to gives thanks. Anytime I've been inside praying visitors respect your privacy, always. If you intend to go to Sunday service get there early you'll be amazed at the crowd. Something I stumbled on was when I got there one day a wedding was finishing up so I walked around the back of the church and was stunned at the reflection in the window, I'll leave it at that. Hope you get a chance to see this gem.

Gran Teton Nat'l Park has beautiful mountains and lake scenery. If you like pretty places, you will like the Tetons. We were glad the clouds were not covering the tops of the mountains this time. We got some great photos.

I have hiked here for 38 years and will say that the hiking is for all levels. But pick you trails carefully as some have a lot of vertical climb and others are just a great stroll. Read the reviews well then choose!
Magnificent mountains with snow in August, lakes, animals. We especially enjoyed Jenny Lake cruise, and Bisons on Mormon Row, up close and personal.
So no matter how much we try we are not touristy people. Although beautiful, it is very crowded, especially Jenny Lake...other places were less crowded. There were wildfires, and it was smokey.

Grand Teton is "next door" to Yellowstone which is far more "excited" and way overcrowded. Here, it offers a sharp contrast, beautiful scenery and tranquility. Remind me of Banff National Park in Canada, my number one favorite park. Sat on a bench staring at the mountains, still covered with a little bit of snow, and the calm Jenny Lake. Then a little breeze. So relaxing that I fell asleep. If you can, have lunch at the restaurant [not cafeteria] inside visitor center and request a table by the huge windows. You may have to make reservation on busy weekends. On the way out of the park, saw a young beaver busily building his new home [dam]. Time to start a new family?
review_title: One of my favorite national parks

review_body: What a wonderful place to see. We did the river rafting trip, and was that great to see, I would recommend the rafting trip while your there.
It looks like someone painted a canvas and not real but it is. Your jaw drops and you are in awe. You take it in and enjoy the view day in and day out.
review_title: It looks like someone painted a canvas and not real but it is

review_body: We saw so much but the bison and Jenny Lake were the highlights for sure. Can't wait to go back! We had adults and kids ranging from 5-13 and everyone was pleased and entertained.

This is the most beautiful mountain range I have ever seen! You have to see it in person to appreciate how spectacular it is. Sunrise and sunset are every more beautiful!! Don't miss this if you are visiting!!

I have ridden through the park many times on my way to Yellowstone. This was the first time I came in on the East side. Such beauty. My only regret was not having even more time to hike and explore the beauty of the park!
Grand Teton is an incredible park. The views and the beauty are amazing. The trees and scenery are beyond words. Fall and spring usually have less people and no traffic. An amazing place on earth.

My husband, sister-in-law, and I were staying for two nights at the Wind River Hotel and Casino at Riverton WY, and decided to drive to Grand Teton NP for the day since it wasn't too far. The park is magnificent! Beautiful views from the time you get close and all the way through the park. Do stop at every scenic pulloff; they're well worth it. We decided a day wasn't nearly long enough to appreciate how lovely this park is, we plan to return and stay longer.

I was unsure what to expect when visiting. Our main focus was Yellowstone. Tetons took the cake. This is a must do trip. Plan on staying and enjoying the area. Jackson Hole was perfect location for our lodging.
review_title: Do not miss out! Most beautiful mountain range I have ever seen<3

review_body: I've been to many locations in the U.S. Rocky Mountain states but there is none better than Grand Teton. There are so many outdoor activities, conducive to most any age group and/or ability. And of course the Teton Range is arguably the most spectacular mountain range in the U.S. I have been to the Tetons three times and my most recent visit will certainly not be my last.
review_title: Best Place in the US Rockies

review_body: We loved our trip to this park. It was so spectacular with beauty beyond measure. I felt like God outdid himself when he made this part of the county. We liked it more than Yellowstone. Can't wait to come back and spend more time as we only did two days.

This visit was my second trip to the Grand Tetons and it was just as amazing as the first. It is an amazing experience and I absolutely recommend it for anyone! The majesty of the Tetons will take your breath away.

This was a bucket-list visit for me.It did not disappoint. Connected to Yellowstone, it is an absolute must-see. We went Aug-16, and I now want to come back in the fall or winter. I can only imagine the views with snow!I could add more pictures, but I think what is already posted tells the story.

WE flew our plane in ourselves and flew on the west and east side of the Tetons, as well as over Yellowstone. Highly recommend Flyjacksonhole aviation for a scenic tour. Lots of great places to eat hiking trails driving around ....etc fly fishing

We started our trip staying at the Jackson Lake Lodge before moving to Yellowstone. The park is easy to navigate, with a large assortment of hiking trails. The views from the Jenny Lake trails are spectacular and the Tetons are uniqueBob G
review_title: As good if not better than Yellowstone

review_body: Visited Grand Teton and Yellowstone NPs on our vacation earlier this month. While Yellowstone was very, very interesting, Grand Teton by far was the most beautiful. Before our visit, a good friend told me Grand Teton NP was by far his favorite. We now see why. To symbolically express his feelings, he said "God sleeps there." Our daughter and boyfriend enjoyed hiking trails in the canyons looking for wildlife. They were thrilled to discover two male moose resting in the shade along a stream in mid-afternoon. The ferry ride across Jenny Lake was a beautiful ride. We booked a raft float trip down the Snake River which was a highlight of our western vacation. Wish we had known about the swimming, kayaking, etc, that was available at String Lake. That would have been a lovely way to spend a hot afternoon. Looking forward to a return visit to Grand Tetons.

We loved visiting the Park. We got to see moose, bear (both a black bear, and a grizzly), deer, and pronghorn antelope. It was a wonderful park, I would encourage you to hike some of the trails that are not normally taken.

On upon of our arrival, the first stop was the visitor center. The ranger was very helpful and gave us information on the things we wanted to see. The views of the mountains was fantastic. The Tetons are shear rock cliffs on the Wyoming side. Just so beautiful.
Seen on different views , lookouts, viewing decks and lakes the mountain is an imposing sight. The best views are by the Jackson Lodge viewing deck and the dam.

So amazing as you drive closer and closer. Every view is a photo. Kids enjoyed the short hike to the lake. the gift store by the interpretive center was really good. Bought ice cream and sweatshirts/t-shirts. Nice short drive from yellowstone park. Fun day trip. Water at the lake was kinda cold reminded me of Lake superior. One time me and the wife did the boat tour years ago but I guess the trail to the waterfall is now closed. So now not much point in the boat ride. Not as much wildlife as yellowstone but still saw a coyote run across the road.
review_title: What a view, I love mountains.

review_body: Grand Teton is my new favorite government park. It has something to offer everyone in the family. Leisurely walks and beautiful scenery for the geriatrics in the family, and vigorous hiking trails to beautiful isolated lakes for the younger set. Whatever your pleasure, you will find it in abundance at this incredible park!
review_title: Worth the trip for the whole family!

review_body: We're on a road trip across America and visiting many national parks. This is one of our favorites! Some of the most beautiful scenery!

The Grand Tetons had amazing views of the Tetons! Pictures attached! The wildlife was lacking a little in comparison to Yellowstone. So much to see in the park though! We did see some deer (bucks). The weather was just right mid 70's.

We used the GypsyGuide app on our iPad to guide us through the park, and let us know of the "must see" sites and how long or strenuous the hikes were. Be sure to download the apps before you leave, as cellular data service is unreliable in the remote areas of the park. We avoided any lengthy hikes, and were able to see the highlights and short hikes in one afternoon/early evening.
Camping,sight seeing,fishing,hiking,there is boating,swimming,bicycling,rock collecting,and many other things to do.it takes day's to do just some of them.

The Tetons are the kind of mountains you draw when you are a child,a row of cones rising straight out of flat ground. So majestic and beautiful with snow tops and glaciers. We just loved driving through the park over and over again. Our favorite sights were Jenny Lake, JAckson lake, Signal mountain, willow flats and the beautiful Oxbow Bend, a vision of green, water and peace. We floated down the snake river with solitude and enjoyed every moment in GTNP. We stayed in Teton Village which is just outside the park gate. Best of all since I am 62 I bought a LIFETIME park pass for $10 good for every national park in the USA! Ten Bucks for Life!!!!!

This makes you stand back and appreciate the diversity of this planet and the many things on this earth that bless our lives. We are very lucky to have such beauty amongst us. We stayed until eh cabins in Coulter Bay. We hiked, rated, and saw wildlife. This was so relaxing and fun for my wife and I. We would really like to return. We've visited 5 national parks in the past year and this is one of the very best.

Breathtaking views. Plenty of opportunities to hike, camp, watch, spot wildlife and enjoy nature. Most of it can be seen driving, but it is highly recommended to hike around. Lake Jenny is worthwatching and hiking around

The Tetons are impressive and the views are amazing. We visited Yellowstone first though and maybe you become a bit spoiled where it comes to unique and awesome nature. Good for a day, you can drive the scenic loop, don't miss the view form Signal mountian and drive the scenic loop at Jeny Lake. We stayed at Colter Bay Campground (be in time as it is 'first come first serve, there might be a queu) but is a good place as a base.

For decades I have wanted to visit Grand Teton and finally did! From the moment I drove north on Rt. 191/89 out of Jackson Hole, my eyes were drawn to the wide open spaces around me. Actually saw a herd of bison off to the right at Antelope Junction -- a few miles south of the Moran entrance to the Park. Those steep spires of granite look like they are painted onto the blue Wyoming sky -- and the views just go on and on. Despite all the tourists (and not being able to find a place to park at the North Jenny Lake Junction, there are numerous pull-overs for taking pictures and reading the informational signs. It was the perfect day to see the park -- some big puffy clouds around, temperatures in the mid-70's. I will long remember this trip!

Beautiful park with many great views of mountains and lakes. Moose and Buffalo can be seen. Be sure to book rooms early especially during the summer months. Do the hike to inspiration point and take a boat ride.
review_title: Beautiful Park with many great views

review_body: Only one word needed to describe the Grand Teton's - Spectacular! The scenery is amazing, and Jackson is a cute town to spend the day browsing and eating in - especially Vom Foss (can't miss store).
The mountains are fantastic.The drive from Jackson, WY to Yellowstone National Park is all that is needed to make the trip amazing. Everything else there comes as bonus.

After driving through Yellowstone, the Grand Tetons are the icing on the cake. They are so lovely! The view is awesome as you leave Yellowstone on Hwy 191 going south. You will probably see several wild animals through this area as well. The Tetons are so pretty on your right as you go south toward Jackson.
The views were amazing. What else can you say? Nature at it's best. This was the beginning of August. The weather was great and it was a shutterbug treat.

Absolutely spectacular! Loved the several hikes that we did: Lake Phelps to Death Canyon, Paintbrush Canyon, and Cascade Canyon. Even with less than desirable weather (rainy and chilly in July) the hikes were awesome, especially Cascade Canyon. The price of the boat ride across Jenny Lake to Inspiration Point and Cascade Canyon was a bit of a surprise for a short ferry ride ($15 RT). It does save around 2 miles to the trailhead so it was worth it to us to save our miles for the Canyon. Loved our visit and hope to return to hike again.
I only had a short time in the area and have been to the Tetons several times but it is always impressive. Well worth the time to visit.

Grand Teton, while much smaller than Yellowstone and without the cool geothermic features (springs, geysers, etc), its worth spending at least a few hours here. You can easily see the highlights all in a days drive if you're heading up to Yellowstone. Jenny Lake, Signal Mountain, Jackson Lake, and Oxbow Bend are the highlights. If your plan was to spend your whole cacation in the Tetons, there's more than enough to do as well. My family and I planned our vacation primarily in Yellowstone, but we spent about 1 day in the Tetons on our drive up and 1 day on our drive back to Jackson Hole. There are plenty of short hikes, viewing points, and opportunities to see wildlife.
review_title: Don't rush through just to get to Yellowstone

review_body: This was our first time to see the Tetons and were were overwhelmed by the beauty of this mountain range and surrounding area and especially Jackson. We'll be back.

Our family has been visiting Grand Teton National Park for over 30 years. It's actually hard to drive through it because it's difficult to "keep your eyes on the road!" It is that breathtakingly beautiful! We have completed probably 10-12 of the hikes in the park, and they're all drastically different. As many visitors as there are at one time, it never feels crowded. String Lake, Jenny Lake, Leigh Lake, and Phelps Lake are all incredibly beautiful in their own way. You could spend an entire week visiting this special place and not see 1/2 of it. Plan your trip carefully to get the most out of your time there. If you have to choose between GTNP and Yellowstone....I would pick GTNP....You won't regret it!

Was staying in Yellowstone but opted to take a drive to the Grand Teton National Park since it is so close. Beautiful mountains. Area around Jenny Lake was under construction and congested. Had my senior pass but never had to show it to get into or out of the park, apparently the entrance stations are south of where we were.

The USA are certainly blessed with wonderful National Parks and Grand Teton is no exception. It has its own charm and various scenic views. The drive from Yellowstone to Jackson, via this Park, was full of photo opportunities, stops and trails. Should not be missed if in the area.
The mountains are beautiful with ample opportunity got hitch hiking . We were short of time and too tired after yellow stones and so could not explore much inside.
Grand Tetons wasn't originally on my list of things to do in life but when traveling close by I'm so happy I went! So beautiful here and peaceful! Defiantly an amazing area!

The Grand Tetons have a tolerant attitude for people who want to be in the remote places. The hiking is fantastic, the Tetons soar above you, the lakes are great for swimming ( once you adjust to their refreshing temperature) and you see eagles, elk, bear, hawks, ravens, and maybe a moose. One hiker came across a grizzly w 3 cubs (and backed away carefully). The rangers put on quality programs. Wonderful for kids too.
review_title: Grand Teton - a park for those who want to be in the wild.

review_body: For stunning mountain and lake scenery...this is THE place. The loop road gets you up close to all the trail heads and the traffic while heavy at times, flows well. Any hike along the GT range is worthy but we particular liked the hikes to Taggard and Bradley Lakes and Spring and Leigh Lakes. If you have non-motorized personal watercraft like SU paddle boards, or kayaks/canoes than bring them along at Spring/Leigh Lakes. Place was full of paddlers and swimmers. For quieter side, take the portage to Leigh Lake. Nearby town of Jackson is a great western town with eateries, shops and galleries galore.

We visited here after Yellowstone and, while Yellowstone is dramatic and diverse, making it a tough act to follow, the Grand Tetons are absolutely beautiful! Think post card picture perfect with clear water and snowcapped rugged mountains. We hiked around Jenny Lake an on up to Inspiration Point. Go up higher if you have the time. This is the prettiest place we've been to. Two days here can be enough if you're in a hurry but stay longer if you can. Go to Moose junction to see moose up close and white water raft on the Snake River.
Awesome lake view, beautiful hikes. Chances of Moose Sighting(we couldn't fine one) May be go early in the day to see one.

If you love nature, open spaces and mountains, this is the park that makes for you.You can follow many paths, discover and meet many wild animals.Being at high altitude, we always hope for good weather, but also possibly if not you can adapt.To visit it well, with a few walks and drive, I recommend at least two days. Always evaluate the interior of the park overnight, because this is always much more expensive.

Spent a couple of days here before heading on two Yellowstone. Beautiful scenery and some nice side drives - I highly recommend the Signal Mountain road. Colter Bay was a nice central place to stay (except for the rotten restaurant).

We enjoyed GTNP so much. The scenery is varied and gorgeous. We hiked several popular trails and found a few that were less travelled. Loved being pretty much alone and eating our packed lunch with no one around. GaperGuide was so helpful.

I highly recommend visiting this national park just south of Yellowstone National Park. This is the ideal drive if you are entering or exiting the south entry. This is a jaw dropping drive that requires you to stop and get photos. The grand Teton mountains are perhaps more beautiful than Yellowstone. As you continue on your drive there are a couple more parks that are just as amazing. If you love nature, scenic drives, mountain, fresh air, and smooth roads you will love it here. It's worth just one breath of this sweet,.fresh mountain air!

What a place! So beautiful and awesome nature! You could not tire of being here, seeing the sights. There are all sorts of activities available all depending of your preferences. I loved my stay, with short walks, boat trip on Jenny Lake and stopping at the sight I liked best.
Grand Teton is awesome - beyond anything I have ever seen. The Chapel of the Transfiguration was so special and very beautiful. I really wish we had stayed a bit longer to enjoy!
Beautiful, majestic and wild. Don't miss Grand Teton if you are going to Yellowstone. This is a totally differently experience.
Spectacular views 10,000 ft. up. Many paragliders. Best way up was the tram. Amazed that there was still snow on the mountain top.
Definitely a bucket list trip. Very close to Yellowstone and worth staying for extra days. Stayed at Colter bay RV park.

Everyone goes to Yellowstone, word to the wise visit the Grand Teton National Park. My family and I stayed at the Triangle X Dude Ranch for a week. Many people had to go to Yellowstone. Everyone came home disappointed. To many people, traffic, construction, ETC...We had the entire Grand Teton Mountains to ourselves. We took a float trip on the Snake River and booked a Fly Fishing trip. We were not disappointed but delighted everywhere we rode the horses, floated down the river, and the wildlife we viewed.

Spent 2 full days hiking and driving around the Grand Tetons. Wish we could have spent more time there. We took the boat across Jenny Lake and hiked up to Inspiration Point and out to Cascade Canyon. It was gorgeous and not a very hard hike, even for 2 out-of-shape city slickers like me and my husband. We hiked part of the way around Leigh Lake, eating lunch at a quiet spot and hiked around Taggart Lake. That was a little creepy because someone had startled a bear in that area and people were afraid to run into that particular bear. That day we ended up hiking 15 miles. We hadn't planned on hiking that much, but, we were enjoying ourselves so much we didn't notice. That day my husband got 3 different love letter emails from his Fitbit for all the hiking we did! A different day we did the 42 mile scenic loop around the Grand Tetons. It was beautiful and very enjoyable. We saw the "Mormon Row", a must if you like taking pictures and stopped at the Jackson Lodge which was very busy with a lot of people, but, had a magnificent view of Jackson Lake and the mountains. We drove up to Signal Mountain and spotted a small bear cub walking on the side of the road. It was around sunset time. All the people desperate to see wildlife- anything! in Yellowstone should drive an hour south and check out the Grand Tetons. Away from all the visitors, that is the better spot for wildlife viewing, methinks. We also stopped at a lookout to the Snake River. The view was breathtaking and when I turned around, I noticed that a fawn was watching us from a short distance. When I go to the dentist or have to endure something I find uncomfortable, I try to envision a beautiful place that I have been to. Now that I have visited the Grand Tetons, I have new footage to work with. Love this place. Just go. And go back as often as you can.

This is one of the Amazing Parks in this area. The mountains are awesome and the lakes are beautiful. My wife's favorite is Jenny Lake, it's crystal clear waters and beautiful rock bottom with multiple colors of rock!
Oxbow Bend Turnout, Grand Teton National ParkUS Route 26, WY.Early morning is the best time to see colors and animals
Grand Teton is a must do when visiting Yellowstone! Fabulous vistas! Your camera will never stop clicking! Scenic roads that lead up to the Tetons are a delight as well!

Grand Teton National Park is one of the true joys of this country. The mountains are unique in that they are relatively young and rise with no foothills with the Grand Teton rising to 13770 feet. The light changes during the day and every phase reveals more of the beauty of the mountains. Be sure to see them after sunset and when the stars are out. The mountains in a full moon are glorious. This is truly a spiritual place.

Grand Teton National park presents some of the most stunning scenery I have seen. The mountains and glaciers are majestic and awe inspiring. The hikes are well maintained and marked. We hikes around String Lake, along Jenny lake and it took about 2 hours. The Park did not disappoint.

Beauty, panoramic, endless, breathless....mountains. The hiking experiences were wonderful. We challenged our selves on each hike. Wildlife abounds. The locals were very friendly and welcoming...also met staff from around the globe. Other vacationers were from all over the US and beyond. The three nights /4 datpys at the park were as full as we wanted them to be. The Jackson lake lodge rooms consisted of a large number of 1 story buildings with nice cabin style rooms. The rooms were large, updated bathrooms all walking distance to the main lodge but a van was available. We went on an enjoyable scenic raft float. The lodge had a few restaurants from very informal to more expensive. There are a few shops on the upper floor of the lodge. The view from the real of the lodge is just amazing. You look out over a huge meadow that may have wildlife with the river just beyond and the Tetons just beyond the river. There's also a couple of easy hikes right from the lodge grounds. The activities desk and staff - ask for Carl- were also very helpful. There's a coral on premises. The little dye location is also good. I could go on but I think u get the idea. Oh..there's no fridge in the room but u can rent one.. Go and assault your eyes with boundless beauty.
review_title: Hard to find words to discribe the beauty

review_body: The view of the Grand Tetons just takes your breath away. No picture can do it justice.There is wild life to see such as Bison and Moose. If you can find it by Mormon Row, you can see the barn from the famous picture with the Grand Tetons in the background. You can also enjoy a slow ride in a raft down the Snake River under these beautiful mountains. All in All my wife and I loved this great park.
The Grand Teton National Park is just beautiful. We went in July so be prepared for the crowds but it was all worth it.
"God's country" Easily my favorite National Park in the US. Has a little bit of everything. Beauty at its finest.

We took a half day to drive through. It was amazingly beautiful. It was clear you could hike, camp, do water sports, which would be fun, but it was enjoyable to just drive through. It was also not as touristy or busy as Yellowstone, which was awesome.

Started our trip in Bozeman and worked our way down thru Yellowstone thru the Grand Tetons. Make sure you visit snake river and Mormon row, some of these pictures were taken there. Beautiful places and great photo ops! We saw a moose when leaving and heading to Jackson, highlight of the trip!

The visitor center here is well worth the trip to understand how the park came to be. And the best view of the grand Teton is right there! The second hiking trail up the road was a perfect hiking choice. It featured beautiful water falls and alpine lakes.
review_title: Magnificient National Park and visitor center

review_body: What an awesome park! We spent two days in Grand Teton NP and just loved it! Both sides of the park are great and we had a great time hiking along some of the trails. We came across a lot of animals (deers, mooses, fox, many different rodents) There are helpful maps available at all park entrances. We recommend this park without any limitation!
review_title: Awesome sights, animals and great hikes

review_body: Its so amazing I didn't feel like I was actually there. Great stops along the route and plenty to do.

My family and I (husband, two kids (4 & 2) and my parents) visited the Tetons this last week and as always it was so hard to leave! We had so much fun doing pony rides, scenic boat tours, playing in String Lake, becoming Junior Rangers and so much more. The park has so much to offer kids/adults of any age! When we were leaving my son cried because he was so sad to leave the Tetons because he loved them so much!

Absolutely spectacular! Kayaked on Jackson Lake around the islands and couldn't have enjoyed it more. Kayaks are first come first serve, but there are lots available and many people returning throughout the morning. Lake view picnic are just north of Leeks marina is a wonderful spit to stop. Great views and easy access to Jackson Lake.

An amazing place you will remember always. Be sure to explore Jenny Lake (either hike around the lake or take the boat across). Hike up to Inspiration Point, and then on through Cascade Canyon. Continue on to Lake Solitude - this will be a 15 mile round trip hike - but it is worth it. Allow a full day so you can take your time. This is the most amazing hike I've ever taken. During June Lake Solitude is still frozen. Take a good camera and bear spray and know how to use both. Take plenty of water - for three of us, we packed 5 liters of water and ran out on our return. We came within 100 feet of a moose, and had several close encounters with smaller animals such as marmots. Other recommendations: whitewater raft down the Snake River; see the Rodeo in Jackson Monday or Wednesday evenings (I recommend reserving seats ahead of time vs. general admission); take the drive up to Signal Mountain for a great view and a picnic; visit the Church of the Transfiguration; explore Jackson Lake and Lodge; drive along Hwy 191 in early morning or evening for a chance to view wildlife - we saw a huge herd of Bison crossing the highway one evening.
review_title: More to do thatn 3 days will allow

review_body: Travelled through here on our way to Yellowstone. Breathtaking views of Snow Capped Mountains, lovely walks round Jenny Lake. A great way to travel from Jackson Hole the visitor centre at Moose Creek is fantastic great information and facilities.
Gorgeous views at every turn! You can take a hike or just sit on the porch and take it all in. Highly recommend.
We go every year it keeps us alive fresh and young....you got to work hard to climb through difficult at times, but the beauty is spectacular and each photo is like a painting!!!
review_title: Climb high and enjoy the sky

review_body: The mountains are beautiful to look at but to really enjoy this place- get out of the car and take a hike. There is a hike for everyone, young or old. Some beautiful lakes and lots of wildlife. Starting out early is a good idea too because trailhead parking fills up by mid-morning and you're more likely to see wildlife. Take the time to enjoy the area!

Most people visit the Grand Teton NP as a side trip from Yellowstone, and I think that's a huge mistake.This park deserves a few days all by itself. We recently stayed in the park for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. The Grand Teton peaks can be enjoyed many different ways and angles - from land and from water. We hiked, swam, and river floated. Jackson Hole was also a very charming town with good restaurants. An overall perfect experience!

We spent a day visiting Grand Teton National Park. This included time spent on a float trip down the Snake River. We then drove through the park from Moose and headed north.We stopped at some of the Lakes. The Lakes were absolutely beautiful, but the parking lots were full. The mountains were stunning.I wish we would have traveled south from Moose to the Teton Village, but time just didn't permit.
review_title: Beautiful park, but not too big!!

review_body: Was here with my family as a child and looked forward to visiting again. My husband and I finally did in July 2016 and it was equally as spectacular. Hopefully this park and the natural beauty will be here for generations to come.
review_title: A national park and forrest at its best

review_body: The tour leaves from Teton Village, which is important if you are staying near town square in Jackson, because its about a 10 minute drive to the meeting place to get on the jeep. Our tour guide Jacqueline was awesome. She knew everything about everything. The animals, the grass, the trees, the history, everything. She was very passionate. We saw moose, bison, elk, and some other animals. Its kind of like hunting, you need to keep your eyes peeled to spot the animals. They are really not that close. They give you binoculars. Its was a good trip though. Btw, there is a $15 charge per person to get into the park, which is not included. And the trip is a solid 4+ hours. Great value for the time, but its a long trip.
review_title: Great way to see the park

review_body: I haven't been to many national parks, but these mountains are majestic. The food that we had while there was hit or miss, but for the actual mountains, the attraction is definitely something to see.
Beautiful park. So grand; so American; so vast. Breathtaking vistas...absolutely stunning. Worth a visit.
Always perfect and the most beautiful hikes. some of the best hikes in the US and incredible animals

Nature is so beautiful in Teton. We saw wildlife and enjoyed the scenery. One of our favorite stops was Jackson Lake. The water is so clear and the view is spectacular. We will definitely be back one day!

Everyone should have the opportunity to visit this spectacular place at least once. It has something to interest everyone no matter their age or background. We are so fortunate to have this park as a national treasure. In just a day, we had a very good overview of the high points of the park so, even your time is limited, do it.

We have an amazing country of diverse and spectacular scenery.The Grand Teton National Park showcases one of the most spectacular mountain ranges that rises above the pairie floor.The glaciers, the conifers, the variety of trails, views, water and waterways, very awesome. And to also be next door to Yellowstone - how cool is that! Last visit a few years back, we stayed at the base of the mountain and hiked, parasailed, soaked it in up close. This time we went fly fishing, biked the main bike trail and enjoyed just as much!

Amazing. Absolutely breathtaking. We went to the lake and took a boat and hiked back to the center and it was beautiful. We had new born teen aged kids and grandmas. It was perfect! A must see and do!

Staying near these sites was pricey but the variety of activities and wildlife made it worth every penny. We stopped at many viewing spots, took the ferry to Jenny Lake so we could hike to Inspiration Point (closed for repairs), floated on the Snake River, visited an abandoned dude ranch where Hemingway once wrote, went to the Menor General Store and nearby Chapel. The new visitor center is terrific for all ages. We saw mom and baby moose, beavers at twilight, pronghorn.
review_title: We stayed in a hostel to see the beauty of this wonderful park!

review_body: This is one of the most beautiful parks in the US - the mountains are spectacular and the streams and lakes are crystal clear. Lake Jenny has some beautiful areas. Hiking, swimming, fishing, canoeing, and kayaking are all available. Keep an eye out for wildlife. You might see bears, moose, elk, wolves, and bison. A must see.

Went rafting on the Snake River with "Salmon River Rafting Company". This was the BEST river trip we have ever taken. Our guide and owner, Wayne Johnson, was so spectacular with knowledge of the natural area and was an expert rafter. He captured our attention for the entire trip, explaining the Grand Teton area, the wild life, the river, and the history of Wyoming. Do Not miss this trip!!!!!
review_title: RAFTING ON THE SNAKE RIVER with Wayne Johnson and the Salmon River Rafting CO.

review_body: Amazing experience visiting the Grand Teton National Park. Worth a visit to stay at Jackson Hole with more choices of accomodation & small city life.

Grand Teton was the first stop for our National Park Tour this summer and it was one of the best parks we visited. The scenery is absolutely stunning which includes plenty of hiking and biking trails. We only wish that we could have spent more time enjoying the park. There are fabulous dining options with mountain views and everyone should take the time to hike Jenny Lake. We will definitely be back and plan more time around Grand Teton National Park.

Absolutely beautiful. This mountain range is one of the most impressive. Bison along the road are picturesque. Wish we would have spent more time in this park before Yellowstone. Not as crowded as Yellowstone.

Park is a short drive from Jackson. Lots to see, including bears, elk, Bison, moose etc. Did not see them all this trip but did see some. The mountains are beautiful and you can see the eadily in the park. Signal Mountain is a great view and worth the side trip up the paved road.

Two weeks were not enough to see and do everything in the Grand Tetons! We tent camped, and spent our days in nature, "Jeeping" and in Jackson (Hole), WY. The town is GREAT, the Tetons are incredible, and we took a day trip to Yellowstone seeing everything!
The only issue is that we wished we had scheduled more time to stay at the Teton area. The hiking trails, canoeing, boat ride, etc. the site is beautiful and lots of hiking trails for all ages.
The Tetons are spectacular, and the roads of this national park take you right up to the mountainside. Views are incredible.

Grand Teton National Park is amazingly beautiful. If you have mobility issues, you can just drive through and stop at some of the many scenic viewpoints to take in the incredible vistas. If you're more able and adventurous, there is hiking, biking, boating, fishing, and more. Definitely worth visiting.

These mountains are absolutely gorgeous. The park has several hiking trails. Several are quite long, a couple that are moderate and a little over a mile round trip.It was $50 for a week pass which includes Yellowstone as well.Not too much food service in the park. Jenny Lake has a General Store. Colter Bay does have a food court. Jackson Hotel has a dining room. We packed a lunch we bought in Jackson (Creekside Market).Very difficult to find info on picnic areas in the park. The majority are located to the north along Jackson Lake heading towards Yellowstone. Cottonwood creek had 4-5 tables and a compost potty. There was 1 table at Teton Glacier turnout. We ate at String Lake. There were 7-8 tables. There is a real restroom. Jackson Dam is another picnic area.Jackson Dam. An attraction that you do not find too much info on. You have to stop here. The views from the dam are breathe taking. Go to both sides of the Snake River for good views as well.So many great stops for pictures. Lupine Meadow rd. is another hidden gem Gets you close to the mountains. We actually could see a waterfall.
An inspirational place to stop. Just off the highway. The view is breathtaking and give you appreciation for the beauty of nature and God.
Wonderful place to begin a vacation if combined with Yellowstone. The park is beautiful. No as hectic as Yellowstone. Lot's to do, but not as large as YS.
review_title: Must Put This Park On Your "To Do"

review_body: You cannot get enough photos of this area as each time you look around it looks different and better. Take a look inside the historic buildings. The church window offer magnificent views through to the Tetons. Try going outside and getting the Tetons reflecting on the window, with the church cross in the background, a great shot.

Let me start by saying that we have teens and a young child. If it weren't so expensive to live in this area, that would be very tempting! We adore the Tetons. You have to visit the visitor's centers, and the views of the lakes and trails are stunning. I would love to come in the fall. We will be back!

This was our first visit to the park and we were awed by the views. We stayed 3 nights and took in all the sights. Early morning was our favorite with some interesting bird sightings at Owbox Bend on the Snake. Early morning reflections of the Tetons on Jackson Lake were beautiful.

We spent 10 days traveling through Yellowstone and Grand Teton Parks. Incredible trip. For me, the 2 parks are so different and really incomparable. We just couldn't tear our eyes away from these mountains! Since they are so young, they haven't formed foothills yet, so you can just touch the sides of their soaring heights!! So peaceful and mesmerizing!!
cabin pic at antelope road. majestic pics. early am pic at oxbow bend. many elk. don't miss turnouts where beaver are. beautiful walk

If your goal is to hike, camp, boat or veg out, the Grand Tetons is your park. Beautiful scenery but all of it can be seen by driving on Hiway 191 without ever entering the park. We wish we had known this before making the 2+ hour trip there and back, when we could have easily seen it the day before by leaving Yellowstone through the South entrance. A learning experience!

We loved the whole drive through. We came from Yellowstone and drove the highway, stopping briefly at the tourist center. There is a great photo opportunity at the Cunningham cabin, and another on Mormon row. I highly recommend these particular spots for family pictures. I am posting them here so you can see how they look. The mountains are just stunning. Try using your panoramic view for smartphone cameras.
review_title: A stunning drive through the park

review_body: We traveled along the Teton Rd to view the mountains and the lake. We stopped at the chapel of the sacred heart catholic church. It was beautiful setting with the mountians and the lake. The church was builded in 1952. Going through Yellowstone National Park from the north entrance took us 4 hours, so we did not get to see much since we still needed to drive back to the hotel that night. If I did it again, I would plan a stay in the Grand Teton and visit Yellowstone.

We enjoyed the park but I have to say that the National Park Systems' Junior Ranger Program was great. There are activities to learn about the park, environment, and animals. The ranger programs were excellent - we went to one about pikas and my kids wouldn't stop talking about them and searching for them. At the end they got sworn in and were given badges or patches which ended up being a great way for kids to start talking to other kids who had earned their badges. It doesn't cost a thing and it's a great activity to do during your trip - I highly recommend it for young kids!
As part of a group tour on 7/7/16. I had the pleasure to tour. Grand Teton national park. I have never seen such a beautiful place.
review_title: Group tour to grand Teton national park

review_body: Wherever you go and walk around Jenny Lake or Colter Bay Village the views are great. Beautiful park, full of animals.
review_title: amazing views of the snow capped mountains

review_body: The grand teton's are awe inspiring. There is much to do. Hiking, fishing, just relaxing, raft trips. See this park. The mountain alone is worth the trip.

GTNP offered spectacular views, great hiking trails and lots of wildlife. The boat ride across Jenny Lake & the hike to Inspiration Point is a must! Also, the Chapel of Transformation was incredible. A must-see!
Beautiful mountain and lakes around it. Glacier mountains prior to going into Yellowstone was a great introduction. We enjoyed Inspiration point ranger guided hike.

Wow. What a place. Breathtakingly scenic at every turn at all hours of the day. Miles and miles of lush landscape and the beautiful snow capped mountains, herds of freely roaming bison, elk and deer. This is the classic American wild. My heart has been taken. Must return to lovely place.

Stayed in Teton Village for 3 nights at Rendezvous D2 Condo'. The village is in a beautiful area, overlooked by the Teton Mountains. My partner and I had been travelling through Colorado and Wyoming and, towards the end of our trip, had arranged to meet relatives in Teton Village before travelling back to Denver and then the UK. The condo was perfect (3 bedroom, 3 bathrooms) and next to a very nice heated outdoor pool and hot tubs. We would have liked to have taken a ride up the mountain on the gondola in the village, but unfortunately didn't have time. We had a couple of meals in the village, found the standard ok but could be improved as soup etc. wasn't served hot and we found the choice of restaurants rather limited. We loved travelling in to Jackson Hole however and exploring the town, museums, riding in the stagecoach etc. there. I expect the Village would be great place to stay for skiing enthusiasts in the winter.
Pictures do not do Grand Teton National Park justice. Seeing it in person is breathtaking! Highly recommend to all!

The mountain views are absolutely gorgeous! The walking/hiking trails are of varying lengths, well maintained and most rated an easy walk. The down side is NO dogs (or other pets) allowed on the trails even if leashed. We stayed at Coulter Bay campground (no reservations allowed - fills on a 1st come basis) and the campground did not fill until after 2pm even on a holiday weekend.
Just spectacular! Put this on your bucket list. Even my very British friend was moved by its beauty. Emotional Brits--not much can do that :)

When Teton and surrounding mountains come into view, it almost takes your breath away. The roads have been designed to make you feel like you're going to drive right into the mountains. I was sad when we had to leave the area.

The Tetons are in-you-face beautiful. We enjoyed the trails, the lodging at Signal Mountain, and the beauty around every corner. Take a boat across Jenny Lake and hike the Cascade Canyon trail (we saw moose!), take in a sunrise at Oxbow Bend, visit Mormon Row and the Snake River Overlook for photo ops, hike String Lake for an easy walk with pretty views. Take lots of water, sunscreen and bug spray to make your trip more pleasant, and bring home tons of memories.
We stayed @ Grand Tetons for 3 days as part of our 18 day road trip. We loved every minute of the area. It's peaceful area & the folks are all so nice.

By far one of my favorite places I have ever hiked and had the pleasure of visiting. The hike from sting lake up to the Inspiration point is wonderful and a must see and do. The canyon trail from inspiration point is the most beautiful places and memorable I have experienced in a long time.

The Grand Tetons were just gorgeous. Weather viewing them from our hotel at Jackson Lake Lodge, the horse trail ride, or floating down the snake river, they were just inspiring. We also traveled across WY and SD through Yellowstone, Big Horn National Forest, Thunder Basin and the Black Hills, but most of our groups of 40 loved the Grand Tetons the most.
review_title: So Beautiful and Scenic you can get lost in the wonder of it all

review_body: The moment our plane landed and we got out of the tarmac, the Grand Teton Mountains are there to welcome you. It was very nice surprise. There's more to see and explore at the mountains, e.g., sightseeing, wildlife safari, hiking (always carry bear spray). It's very easy to take great pictures in Wyoming, so take lots of pictures.
What a place! What a Park! A Must See! Truly enjoyed every place and aspect of it. Just give yourself plenty of time to see everything so that you can.

My family spent two half day at Grand Teton during our combined Teton and Yellowston trip at the end of May. Lakes were free of ice already but we didnt take the boat ride across Jenny Lake as we were told at the visitor center that there were quite some construction on the other side which takes the beauty away. We instead drove the scenic circle drive, made an easy short hike along String Lake the first afternoon. The next morning, we stop by Antelope Flat Rd and Mormon Row which was perfect spot for photo shot of the Teton mountains, then hiked Heritage Point trail near Colter Bay Village. We loved the trail, easy walk with beatiful view of the lake, pond, reflection of the mountains and woods.
This park has it all - gorgeous mountains, lovely lakes, proximity to a city (Jackson), wildlife galore. Highly recommended!!

My wife and I visited after some days in Yellowstone. Yellowstone is fantastic, but Teton is just spectacular. The awe inspiting mountains dominate the sky. There is abundant wildlife, but the roads not as confining as Yellowstone. I would recommend the Jackson Lake dinner cruise - where the guides are very informative and the dinner on Elk Island is actually surprisingly excellent and almost worth the trip to the island! We also took a Snake River raft cruise where you lazily float down the river with a very informative guide and it is just apart from civilization - although my wife's cell phone rang in the middle of the cruise! There are many trails you can hike or small dirt roads you can drive down where you can be completely alone - just bring bear spray to be safe. The town of Jackson is just a short drive away and is also worth a visit. I definitely plan to return. More than I expected.
review_title: Breathtaking and inspiring! Simply the best!

review_body: So much to offer here and do. The scenic drive to look for animals, go fishing or rafting, take a hike, go biking- almost endless opportunities. And that's just the summer. I can only imagine all the options in the winter. Another gem in the National Park system, great for the whole family.
Had a great time here. We did a scenic float trip down the Snake River, rode horses, did the tram up to Rendezvous Mountain to 10,450 feet and visited various areas of the park.

We barely scratched the surface of this park and were still blown away. We found the park easy to navigate and filled with hikes and views to take in. While we were only here one day we managed to take a 2 horse back ride that gave the family life long memories.

perfect place for balance of nature water, mountains, trees and wildlife; beauty at each breath It is confusing to me why this does not rate as highly as Yellowstone, to me it is more beautiful. We saw moose, and heron, and muskrat and bear... wonderful hikes in splendor...

We love this National Park it is completely different from its neighbor, Yellowstone. Grand Teton and Mt Moran are magnificent. Cannot wait to visit it again. We went to 13 National Parks in our road trip in June. This National Park is one of our favorites!
Relatively small national park, easy to see in two days. The most incredible views of any national park we've ever be!en to

These mountains formed as one tectonic plate was forced under the other, (typically both rise). The result is a beautiful view without the typical foothills. Jackson Lake (at the very foot of the mountains) is over 450 feet deep at its lowest.
We had a great time kayaking Jenny Lake, Two Ocean Lake, and the Snake River. The Lizard Creek Campground was perfect. Boating on Jackson Lake was breathtaking.

We spent four days in the Teton area before heading to Yellowstone, and we enjoyed the Tetons just as much as Yellowstone. The two parks are very different. Be sure to drive the Teton Grand Loop, and stop any place you like. The scenery is beautiful any where you go. There are plenty of vehicle pull over spots, and plenty of primitive restrooms along the way. Be sure to take a cooler for drinks and food as you may be too far away from a food source. Take time to stop at the Jenny Lake Overlook or hike around the lake for at least a little distance. You can also take a boat across Jenny Lake for a scenic ride. We also drove to the top of Signal Mountain for breath taking views. A stop at Jackson Lake will also give you more beautiful photos and a chance to soak in the beauty. All of the sights are well marked, and you can spend as much time in this park as you want. Just slow down and enjoy it. You won't have the huge crowds that you have in Yellowstone, but it is always good to get out early for good photo light and to increase your chances of seeing wildlife.

The drive up to the eastern entrance was pretty at dawn with the mountains peeking out over the trees. Not even a few miles past the entrance, I saw a grizzly chomping on some grass off the side of the road. Parking at most visitor centers were easy enough except for the Jenny Lake area, there is a lot of construction going on. I would say their best visitor center was Craig Thomas and Discovery Center. If you want to catch any view points from the eastern most road, try to drive it earlier in the day when the sun gits the mountains or the barn along Mormon row, or else you'll get silluattes if too late in the day.
We had a blast hiking up to Inspiration Point (2 families with 3 kids ages 7-11). My husband went up farther to get up to the snowline. Take the Ferry back!
Absolutely breath taking. We took a Sunrise Expedition tour with the Teton Science School and it was amazing. We spotted numerous buffalo, moose, pronghorn antelope and numerous birds on our trip.
Went as part of a bus trip and took a rafting trip down the Snake River. It was a pretty mild ride down the river but lasted a few hours.

My son and I had a wonderful vacation in the Grand Tetons. We are both photographers and there was plenty to photograph! We did the loop scenic tour and had a lot of fun finding all the historic and interesting places on the list. The Visitor Center is fantastic and very helpful. We also took a wildlife tour which we enjoyed a lot and got a lot of beautiful photos. The whole area is a picture postcard and we loved it! If you want a wonderful vacation head to the Grand Teton National Park!!!
review_title: Grand Tetons - Wonderful Place for a Vacation

review_body: We rode by and through part of this beautiful scenery in Wyoming after leaving Yellowstone national Park. The ride that brings you within view of this mountain range after leaving Yellowstone is amazing in itself. The various elevations you pass through give you a unsurpassed view of these scenic wonders. The Grand Tetons offer a completely different perspective of mountain scenery than when we were in Yellowstone.A ride through some of the mountains or a scenic ride down the Snake river within the mountain range offers breathtaking views with unsurpassed scenery. I definite must when going through this part of Wyoming.
review_title: Magnificent pinnacles reaching into the Clouds!

review_body: After an awe inspiring drive on the Going-to-the Sun Road at Glacier National Park, we expected to have a similar experience at Grand Teton National Park. Instead of a winding drive through the mountains, we discovered you only get to see them from afar as you drive parallel to the mountain range along the park road. Stupendous mountain range but disappointed in not being able to more of them close up.
This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever been! The views from the park were so beautiful! I would highly suggest loop around the park!

In spite of more people than ever before visiting the national parks, I would still say it's one of the best family destinations. There's so much to do, regardless of your vacation budget. We highly recommend doing a float down the Snake River if you have more money, and if not, there are many different trails you can hike. One thing I enjoyed greatly was touring the Bill Menor cabin and ferry - the ferry wasn't operating yet when we were there, but the lady in the cabin/shop was knowledgeable and very friendly. Many nice things you can buy and it helps support the park. I love history, so seeing things and pictures from back 100+ years ago was very cool.
2nd trip thru Yellowstone on the way to Jackson Hole. The Grand Tetons are just that...Grand!!!! Dramatic and beautiful. Makes Yellowstone look boring in comparison.

We were driving towards the Grand Teton Park from Jackson and there comes a point where you suddenly see the mountains.Both of us in the car audibly said "Wow".Drove the 40+ mile loop, which took many hours as there is so much to see. Also walked up to Inspiration Point, with stunning views.

This was our first trip to the Grand Tetons. The mountains are breathtaking. We enjoyed a float trip down the Snake River and a jeep tour looking for wildlife. I highly recommend this park, you won't be disappointed.

We spent 4 days here after about a week in Yellowstone. (If you are dividing a trip between the two, that ratio worked well.) We hiked at Jenny Lake and did some loop hikes around the lakes near Jackson lake lodge that were 6-8 miles, but not much elevation gain. I'm sure there are much more challenging options out there. We also really enjoyed a day with the Teton Science School. Through out our time in the park we saw fox, coyote, bison, eagles, beaver, muskrat, prong horn, deer, and many types of birds.

Grand Teton National Park scores pretty high in the beauty scale. It has grand mountains, crystal clear lakes and prairie lands. Some of the roads around Moose,Wyoming are only open in the summer with good reason- we thought our mini-van may fall apart on the rocks and bumps. They had a sign up that they were going to be fixing the roads and that road closures were coming. If you are looking for a moose, Grand Teton is the place. We were told by a ranger that years ago during a wildfire in Yellowstone - the moose all migrated to the Grand Tetons and never returned North. We were lucky enough to see a bull on those back bumpy roads near Moose, WY. The Jenny Lake Visitor Center is under construction - it was very crowded while we were there. If you are looking to rent a boat on any of the lakes - there is a 2 hours minimum for all boats including kayaks. Kayak rental is about $22 and hour. Be sure to go to the dam area ... that is were you can take those great mountain pics. Definitely a national park that needs to be on your list of places to see!

Enjoyed 3 days in GTNP as part of a combined trip with YNP. This is truly a beautiful place. Even with intermittent rain and clouds during our stay it was spectacular. Many just drive through on their way to Yellowstone. It's worth a few days. Why?: One, Yellowstone is crowded. GTNP is much less so. Two, the alpine hikes like Cascade Canyon are unmatched. Three, the views. It's worth the time to see the mountains from near, far, from the water (kayak the Oxbow) and from north and south. Four, lots more moose. Finally, it's not why you come but much better food.
This place is absolutely stunning. The most awe inspiring landscapes I have ever seen. This should be on everyone's bucket list.

Grant Teton National Park is breathtaking. The mountains are magnificent, the lakes beautiful, the forests gorgeous and overall, this park has something for everyone.I've been coming here for about 10 years, mostly in the late spring or early fall, either before the crowds arrive or after they've left. In early and mid June, the wild flowers are blooming on the open meadows with Balsam Arrowroot, Lupine, Indian paintbrush just a few that cover the hillsides and open areas. In September, we watch the daily progression from green to brilliant yellow of the aspens as they turn hillsides into gorgeous yellows and orange pictures. Of course, the animals are so special. We see bison, elk, moose, pronghorn antelope as well as bald eagles, osprey, while pelicans, herons, and many smaller birds. In the fall, it's often easier to encounter the bears, although this spring we saw a mother black bear with three cubs. Fortunately, we were far enough away that while she clearly knew we were there from our loud off-key singing, she made no effort to charge us. She did tree her cubs for awhile, but then took them further down the mountainside. We always carry bear spray.I love to hike and this year a group of friends of varying fitness enjoyed the lovely hike around Two Ocean Lake. Three of us climbed up the Grand View which was definitely worth it, but for the two that didn't go, that was a wise decision. It was a very steep climb. Another group of us hiked past Bradley Lake to the junction of the trail from Lupine Meadow. It was a moderate hike with a few strenuous stretches, but wonderful scenery. And the wildflowers were so beautiful.We also visited the Laurence Rockefeller Preserve, which has a lovely pavilion, serene meditation room and library with a history of the Rockefellers in the area. There are also several hikes that people of almost any fitness level can take that end at Phelps Lake. These tend to be very crowded routes, but still worth the views of the lake and the surrounding mountains.This is definitely a Must See national park.

This is a great place to come in the summer time. We camped at Signature Lake and it was great. Not to many people, there are bathrooms and showers. And the staff was great. We hiked a couple of the trails in the local area, most were easy. The city of Jackson is very equipped with bike paths even outside the town there are bike paths everywhere, if we had known we would have definitely brought our bikes. Great family vacation spot there is a lot to do. It is also a ski town.
review_title: We stumbled upon this great little town.

review_body: Stunning, almost surreal views. Catch it on a day with a cloudless blue sky and its breathtaking. Grand Teton is a must see if you enjoy nature
review_title: Our favorite place on this planet!

review_body: The views of mountains and lakes are amazing! Everywhere you look there are animals and birds or rivers and streams to enjoy. the Park is very well maintained and the Rangers are on their jobs. When there is a bear siting they get traffic flowing safely around those of us watching with binoculars. We stayed a week and it went by very quickly!

The views coming down from Yellowstone to the Grand Teton National Park are unique in that there's no foothills to block the towering peaks. You get great views from a distance and then of course you need to venture further into the park to appreciate the hidden beauty and the wildlife.
great park ranger guided walks - especially informative geology interpreter; fantastic hikes. Great views from everywhere, Good access to facilities.

Just drove through the Park in 2001, on our way to the park next door. Thought we should spend more time here so had a two night stay at Jackson Lake Lodge, it was great. I think that all I need to say is slow down take your time, stop get out of your car take a look around you, it's fantastic!

Although we spent a total of five nights inside Grand Teton NP we could have spent more time. We went to all the Visitor Centers, rode up Signal Mountain, biked from Jenny Lake Lodge to Jenny Lake Visitor Center, took the boat across the lake, hiked to Hidden Falls and Inspiration Point, took 500 pictures of the Tetons and Lakes, searched for Moose, viewed many animals, drove all the roads, took a rafting trip of the Snake River, enjoyed sunrise and sunset viewing the Tetons. This is my favorite National Park.
review_title: So Much To See And Do and Not Enough Time For it All

review_body: Spectacular park and a better place to see a moose than Yellowstone! The mountains look different from every angle and position of the sun so new views and photo opportunities are endless.
review_title: Best place to see a moose!

review_body: My husband and I recently visited this beautiful national park. After visiting this park, the song, " America the Beautiful," has a whole new meaning. This is one of the most beautiful places on earth. The scenery is stunning. But don't overlook the wildlife. We visited in late May and saw all kinds of wildlife, buffalo & their calves, wolf, deer, pronghorn, elk, and even moose. This is a great place to visit. I just wish we could have stayed longer!

This was my 4th visit and my wife's first. She was awestruck by the beauty of the snow capped peaks, lakes & scenery, as I have been since my first visit 40 yrs ago. I especially love walking the trails along Jenny Lake to photograph the bright blue waters with the peaks behind. Filming deer, antelope and moose was an added bonus. We visited the park twice from our hotel in Jackson Hole. I recommend taking the Wilson Rd to the park entrance which is narrow and only partially paved. Drive slow and watch for moose & bear. Get to Jenny Lake early or after 4PM to avoid the crowds. The trail around the lake, leaving Ranger station turn right and follow the trail signs, in 1/2 mile take some of the side trails to the lake edge and enjoy the beauty and tranquility. I find that most tourists are too lazy to walk even 1/2 mile, so you should have a little alone time at the beach. You can also do the complete hike around Jenny Lake if you have the time.

most people spent lots time at yellowstone and skip Teton Park, but the Grand Teton is unique with the mountain and several lakes, You will find lots sports activities at there and you won't miss tramendous picture taking opportunities. I'd recommend you stay in Signal mountain lodge at least two or three days.

When one visits the Grand Tetons, you almost feel that you are in the mountains. the views are amazing. There are great hikes. We hiked to Heron Pond & Swan Lake. We also hiked along the shore trail of Jackson Lake. We hiked String Lake, north of Jenny Lake to Leigh Lake. Our teens kayaked in Jackson Lake off Colter Bay. We drove up Signal Mountain for the magnificent views of the Tetons. We visited oxbow Bend and Willow Flats. There are so many wonderful experiences there. You are limited by your time constraints.

Grand Teton national Park is a true gem among jewels. It is spectacular, the majesty of those mountains is just breathtaking. Plus, it was really uncrowded and easy to get around.If you were planning on going to Yellowstone, you absolutely must build in at least two days to come see this amazing park. My whole family and I personally preferred grand Teton over Yellowstone unanimously
review_title: The best national Park I have ever visited

review_body: We visited this park some years ago on a coach trip and this time we had a rental for our vacation so we could spend more time exploring. The Mountains are visually stunning and its nor over commercialised like some of Yellowstone. It has a more backwoods feel and when the first animal you see is a wolf running across in front of the car at the entrance gate you feel you are in for a treat. We also saw a grizzly bear by the roadside as well as deer and pronghorn. We didn't see Moose on the day we visited but they are known to frequent the area and when we drove past the next day saw one coming out of the aptly named "moose head ranch" Awesome!

We went to this place on our trip to yellow stone.This park this.has many beautiful mountains and many spots.lakes and mountains,reservoirs ,waterfalls and so many stops you can make.May be you need one full day for seeing

The Tetons are phenomenal! Gorgeous! I highly recommend the hike from S Jenny Lake to Hidden Falls and Inspiration point.
