review_body: We camped for 3 nights last week and can say this was a most beautiful park. The colors of the aspens peaked as we were leaving. We had also stayed at Yellowstone right before Teton and can say we thoroughly enjoyed the much more laid back atmosphere and less tourists at Teton. The mountains are just gorgeous. The lakes are wonderful and there are good hikes and views to be had.

Like others, I had never heard of the Grand Teton National Park until we actually got there. The landscapes are striking and very memorable. The mountain range rises abruptly from the valley floor and is a stunning example of the powers of nature. A day out to drive through the park is highly recommended.
review_title: The Teton Range may be looked after by the Park Service, but nature take a bow !

review_body: While my husband and I aren't big hikers, we greatly enjoyed driving through the Grand Tetons. The mountains are stunning, and the changing colors of the fall leaves were gorgeous this time of year. The park wasn't overly crowded, and I'm so glad we took the extra time to take this route to Yellowstone, vs. entering through West Yellowstone.
I love looking at mountains and the Grand Tetons are some of the most majestic mountains you will ever see! You will take a zillion pictures!

Arrived via airplane at Jackson Hole, Wyoming. Had a rental car reserved and immediately explored Grand Teton. Views of the mountains were fantastic. On the way home, my friend and I noticed people looking over a bridge. We drove by and saw a Moose below the bridge. Watching him was a nice way to end the day!
We'd never even heard of these impressive mountains before this tour. On the road from Jackson to Yellowstone they are on view the whole way. On a clear day they are just majestic - sharp as daggers.

The Teton Mountains were some of the most beautiful mountains I've seen. We loved the park and especially enjoyed the ranger led wildlife caravan. Make sure to try and take advantage of as many ranger led activities as possible, they can really make the most of your experience in the park
The views are outstanding. Drive by Jenny Lake on Teton Park Road for the closest views. There are several pull offs for viewing.

To understand the Tetons you have to experience them in person. A mountain range within a mountain range. Young mountains that simply are beautiful. Take the time to visit the many points of interest you won't be disappointed.

We visited Grand Teton National Park a few days ago for the first time. We were amazed by it's beauty. Teton mountains and the lakes were absolutely stunning. It felt amazing to breathe crisp mountain air. Trees were changing colors. We saw the moose and some other wildlife. I highly recommend to stop by Jenny Lake and take a gondola ride. We both regret for not visiting Grand Teton National Park sooner. As we were standing there admiring it's beauty, we thought how lucky we are to be the citizens of our beautiful country.
review_title: Must visit at least once in a lifetime

review_body: One of our favorite national parks. We have traveled to this area repeatedly over the past 15 years. The scenery coupled with the variety of wildlife is just amazing. So grateful that this area has been preserved as a NP.

We love Yellowstone Park. That said, there are lots of people there. We had never taken the loop through the Grand Teton Park before. We saw lovely views and lots of the same animals with a fraction of the people. I would not skip Yellowstone, but I recommend taking the time to drive through the Grand Teton Park instead of just driving past on the main road. The leaves are changing and it's beautiful with the Snake River running through it.
review_title: Nice Place Less Crowded than Yellowstone

review_body: Just a fabulous place to visit. If you love hiking, this is the place to be. We also had a cruise on the Snake River and went on a breakfast cruise to Elk Island on Jackson Lake. Lovely
review_title: Grand Teton is worth visiting if you like the outdoors

review_body: View the Grand and the surrounding peaks form several vantage points. The views from the valley show their spectacular prominence. If you're able, I'd highly recommend some of the hikes to get a closer view and a more immersive experience. The most iconic hike we did was on an un-maintained, unofficial bushwhacking trail (which shall remain nameless to protect it from the masses, sorry).
Don't miss this area. Try to go when your young enough to enjoy the hiking! Still great car tours if you cant walk too far. Awesome history, scenery second to none.

There are enough things to do in this park to keep you busy and entertained for several days. There certainly is a lot to see. Mostly, we sat in awe looking at the magnificent mountains from the vantage point of several locations including Jackson Lake Lodge, Oxbow Bend, Signal Mountain Lodge, Jenny Lake and the many pullouts on the “Inner Loop” Teton Park Roads well as the Route 191. We enjoyed hiking the trails at Colter Bay and the hikes to hidden falls and inspiration point. The drive up Signal Mountain Road was worth the views at and near the top. The drive to Two Ocean Lake – perhaps not worth the “fun” of the dirt road.We sighted moose at moose junction (go figure), Bison and Pronghorn all along route 191, fox at our Colter Bay campsite, mule deer along campsite hiking trails and along Moose-Wilson road, birds on lakes and woods everywhere.There are three excellent dining options at the Jackson Lake Lodge which provide amazing views of the mountains. The Dornans area also had a Chuck Wagon outside dining area with good burgers. We also enjoyed the dining at the famous Ranch House at Colter Bay near our campsite.

Absolutely loved Grand Teton National Park! The mountains are beautiful...very scenic area. Lots to drive around and see, as well as hiking trails. Beautiful waterfall at Hidden Falls/Inspiration Point. Also got to see some wildlife on Antelope Flats. Would recommend 2-3 days if you plan to hike; if you only plan to drive and sight-see, 1-2 days would be plenty.

We went through the Grand Tetons on the way to Yellowstone and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip! This is the place to go if you want to see abundant wildlife. We saw several bears including grizzlies, Lots of elk, Moose, Fox, etc.... We camped in the campground which was pretty nice. It's just an overall Beautiful Place!!!

Colors were magnificent. We booked a day-trip through Viator. There were six of us: two couples and two single travelers. It was great to have someone else do the driving and tell us about the area. We saw Buffalo, deer, elk, pronghorn, bears and eagles. We also saw a mountain bluebird. Mormon row was very interesting, too. We traveled to the top of signal Mountain for a scenic overlook of the area.It's a great time of year to visit with the seasonal colors, plus low traffic due to school being in session. We plan to take another tour tomorrow in her own vehicle.The Jackson Lake visitor center had nice things for sale, plus comfy sofa and chairs surrounding a blazing fire with snowshoes crossed at the top.
Fantastic scenery. A must visit if you're in the area. Wonderful hiking trails - Taggart Lake and Hidden Falls a must.
The views, the lakes, the grandeur. Please, please, do what you can and visit this spectacular national park!

The National Park is tremendous. The primary attraction is of course the mountain range, which is stunning. But don't forget the rest of the park, including Jenny Lake and Jackson lake, and the views over the Snake River popularized by Ansel Adams. Then there is of course the wild life; moose and elk primarily. Check out Mormon Row at Antelope Flats, and do some cycling or walking on the many trails. It's a fabulous destination.
review_title: Stunning views of the Tetons, great wild life opportunities.

review_body: It was a last-minute decision to head south to visit Grand Teton National Park while in Yellowstone. It turned out to be our favorite stop. The mountain views are amazing!We ended up staying down there two nights as we loved the park and are campground was really great. We rented in the Colver Bay campground. Sites were far apart and quiet. They were situated among tall trees. No showers but there are nice pay showers not far away. We ate at the Jackson Lodge (Grill and Mural Room) several times. Both are great. Sit in the lodge lobby after the meal enjoying the view of the Tetons from the large windows. This is especially nice at sunset.Jenny Lake offers good hiking and views. Just driving from place to place, the mountains fill the view in front of you. You'll want to be the passenger through this place. One of my favorite parks if not the nicest place I've ever seen!
review_title: A must! This place should be on everyone's bucket list

review_body: Grand Teton is a beautiful national park. We stayed there for 2 days and did a lot of hiking there. Do your research before your trip to see what kind of trails you'd like to do. Come with the right clothes, take a small bagpack for rain jacket and water. It rained for 2 days but with the rain jackets we did the trails with no problem. Trail shoes are highly recommended (especially when it rains). We did buy a bear spray for $45, non refundable. Don't be a hero, buy one, most people do.
The sunrise view up on Signal Mountain summit is amazing!! You must do Moose-Wilson Rd. We say bear and saw moose close to Jenny Lake. Stunning scenery!

This was our 1st stop on our Yellowstone & surrounding area. The Mt. range is amazing. Unfortunately the skys were a bit clouded w/the smoke from the fires out west, but despite it photos still show the depth & perspective. The visitors center is quite informant & a cool looking building as well. There is a huge wall of windows lokking out to the Tetons & the floor is marked w/the Mts. you're viewing. Took the 5 mile hike around Jenny Lake up to Hidden Falls & took the boat back to the visitors center, which has a $9 fee. A nice start to our day.

Scenic Tour on Jenny Lake was booked up. We took round trip to and from Jenny Lake. Wow beautiful place. On other side of Jenny Lake were various hiking trails. We hiked to Hidden Falls and enjoyed a short snack we had packed. Take water with you. Highly recommend this boat trip in Jenny Lake. Can take some great pics of Tetons.

We drove from Jackson WY to Gradiner MT via Grand Teton. up 191, which runs through the park from south to north. The scenery all along this drive is incredible. When I think of the Rocky Mountains, these are the views I think about. There are many pull off's along the way where its possible to take great pictures (most seem to be on the side going toward Jackson and traffic can make crossing back and forth difficult) and there are stops along the way (camp grounds and so forth). The lower portion of the drive along the Grand Teton's is outside the National Park itself and is, therefore, at no charge. The park contains parks, well developed camp grounds (with stores, laundries, and shower facilities) and beautiful lakes, which reminded us of Scotland. Grand Teton is truly a wonderful experience and is well worth the charge. It was moderately busy when we were there in September (it closes mid October); however, I was told that the shoulder seasons (including September) are much better visiting times than the summer itself when it is very crowded.

My girlfriend and I actually preferred Grand Tetons to its more popular and famous neighbour Yellowstone. It felt a lot more accessible. Maybe we just got lucky because the wildlife was great - lots of black bears on the moose - wilson road. There appears to be good hiking around, and there were lots of place to drive to, park up, and watch for wildlife. Some great scenery as well.

This church has a background that would make it difficult to concentrate on a sermon. It is stunning in its beauty, and it makes for a beautiful photo opportunity from an outside standpoint. However, even with quality photographic equipment, it would be very difficult to capture a stunning photo of the interior of the chapel and the mountains as well. If a photographer would choose to capture this image, you would need to light the interior of the chapel and / or come at a very early or very late time of day. No matter what your interest, this chapel is worth a visit when you vacation in the Tetons! Enjoy!!
review_title: Beautiful Scenery- begs to be photographed!

review_body: And I've missed some beautiful scenery. If you can, take the boat across Jenny Lake (it runs something like every 15 minutes between 10am and 4pm from South Jenny Visitor's Center) and hike half-a-mile to Hidden Falls. It's worth the effort! And if you get stuck on the other side, you can hike three miles to get back to South Jenny. This 30-mile string of mountains is beyond beautiful! Someone else said "breathtaking", or I would have said it, too! If you're staying close enough, you'll also have time for a piece of Yellowstone, my all-time favorite National Park. Enjoy!

Hadn't been to the Park for 43 years. I believe it is more beautiful than ever. The jagged peaks against the blue sky takes your breath away. When we were there other times (in our younger days) we hiked in the mountains. This time we drove the various roads thru the Park and I enjoyed it just as much. The time of day makes such a difference in the appearance of the mountains. Take time to enjoy them morning, noon and sunset. I believe this is my favorite national park.

We did the Taggart Lake Trail in the late afternoon and early evening, excellent time to go. Most folks hike thru without paying attention to what is going on off the trail, spotted a female moose working it's way down to some vegetation 50 feet off the trail. She came down and ate for about a half-hour. We did the same trail another day and went to Bradley Lake first then to Taggert, moderate the whole way. While sitting on the rocks along Taggart Lake spotted a Black Bear swimming across the lake, it got out and made it's way up into the woods. The view of the Tetons from Taggart Lake is spectacular.
review_title: Taggart Lake Trail in Grand Teton Park

review_body: beware that the hiking trails marked easy are not necessarily a breeze and that in the off season the Jenny Lake shuttle hours are limited....our 15 mile hike turned into 22!!! a killer when we missed the last ferry!

Stunning views. This is a beautiful park and we truly enjoyed our time visiting it. The boat ride on Jenny Lake was informative and beautiful. We had a picnic lunch along String Lake, while enjoying the scenery. We look forward to visiting the park another time.

Breath taking scenery of nature at it's best. We stayed in Dubois, WY which is 56 miles from the park, less than an easy hours drive on some beautiful roads. We could not get a room in the park in the second week of September. When we go again, we'll try to book a room in the park. That would give us more time to explore. We spent 2 days in the park. Walking the trails, taking lots of photos. Some trails are not marked too well once you start out. Many are long so staying in the park would help. If you are 2+ years old you can get a senior pass from any National Park for $10. This is a life time pass and gets you into all NP's for free. Grand Teton is worth the $30 fee, but even better with a senior pass.
Stunning views, wild animals, great places to eat. Photographed bears, moose up close. Recommend a visit to Grand Teton Park for anyone visiting the Jackson Hole area.
Wildlife to look for and breathtaking views of the HUGE mountains and peaks. Good views of the valley too.
My favorite experience was the Jenny Lake cruise. We had such a informative tour guide, and the scenery was gorgeous.
review_title: Beautiful scenery. Loved our time here although we didn't see any animals.

review_body: The Tetons are beautiful,but if you go the hotels are very expensive.We enjoyed just riding around looking.

Such a beautiful park to visit! From Moose Junction in the south to the northern camping and boating areas in the north, this part offers so much! The chapel shown in the upper left corner is a delight to see, the flora and fauna are unrivaled, and you get a close-up view of lakes, mountains, hiking trails, boating, moose, elk, bears, birds, beaver, you name it.

While Yellowstone is so crowded you feel like you're in an amusement park, the Tetons offer the quiet of nature (as long as you go outside the most popular hikes). We hiked the Paintbrush Canyon to Cascade Canyon loop and saw maybe 25 people the whole time. Granted it was a crazy long and arduous hike! I would go back to the Tetons in a heartbeat, it was exactly what I want in a nature- based vacation. I would recommend bear spray just in case though.
review_title: One Of My Favorite National Parks

review_body: We've stopped off the highway at look-out areas on the highway out of Jackson Hole many times, but this is the first time we've actually gone into the park. Yellowstone is unique, but Grand Tetons holds the same breath-taking scenery. It's also much easier to find a camping spot than Yellowstone during the busy weeks.
What an amazing natural resource. Beautiful hiking trails and extraordinary scenic views. Several well done Visitors Centers.
review_title: A National Park you have to visit

review_body: Good views of the mountains from several turn outs off the main road but unless you are into hiking there is not much else to see and unlike Yellowstone we did not see any wildlife.

We visited The Park recently and it was spectacular! The Park has a loop that is about 42 miles from start to finish with many amazing stops along the way. We stopped at Jenny Lake, Signal Mountain, Snake River Overlook, Mormon Row, and Church of the Transfiguration while we were there and highly recommend all of these stops. There are many other stops along the way but time did not allow us to stop by them. Please make sure that you stop by the Visitor Center near the entrance of The Park. It is really nice and has a great summary of The Park as well as very friendly staff that can tell you the history of The Park as well as other things that you need to know.

If this park was somewhere else it would get a 5 from me. But when I drove to Yellowstone and I can only give Yellowstone a 5, then Grand Tetons is a notch below. The landscapes are beautiful with the backdrop of the mountains and Jackson Hole is a cute town. However, if you have limited time, you will be better off driving from Jackson Hole directly to Yellowstone. More beautiful and varied sights and animals everywhere.
review_title: It is not a 5 because Yellowstone is just a drive away.

review_body: If you are anywhere close it is absolutely worth the time and the money to go into the park. There are several different entrances, from different directions. Take your time.....enough said.....

I LOVE this majestic park! It has so many beautiful areas to go hiking and animal watching! I have seen elk, moose, bears, pikas, marmots, snakes, eagles, beavers, chipmunks, squirels, mule deer, and many birds. It is breathtaking to live and work here for the summer! You better give yourself at least a week in order to taste each type of hike and scenery.
It was so beautiful, worth the drive or even a walk on their many trails. I'm hoping to come back and walk more of the trails!

We are National Park junkies. It hard to be objective because they are all excellent and beautiful in their own way. We hadn't been to the Grand Tetons (barring driving through from Yellowstone to Jackson). There was a variety of activities. We dayhiked, canoed, floated the snake river, took in historical sites, and looked for wildlife. We definitely saw a lot of wildlife - Elk (lots), pronghorns, fox, coyote, beaver, bald eagles, grizzly bear, wolverine! Beautiful scenery every where.

Compared to Yellowstone to the north, Grand Teton is small. But don't be fooled. The scenery is amazing. The day we went it was hazy so most of my pictures aren't great. I had been before so that was OK. The views are truly breathtaking. We didn't hike because my husband has back problems. We were able to see many of the iconic sights in less than a day. But you can take much longer if you hike.
review_title: Superb National Park - Small but Excellent

review_body: On a recent road trip where, amongst other things, we visited 6 national parks, we spent an afternoon and the following morning in Grand Teton National Park. Think this was one of my favourites - definitely enjoyed more than Yellowstone. We stopped in at the visitor centre in Jackson about lunch time and had the good fortune to talk to an employee there who was obviously quite passionate about the park. He drew us a route on the map and pointed out things of particular interest which we would in all likelihood have missed had we not spoken to him first. For instance, in one example of many, he told us of a side dirt road in which a large herd of bison had been seen that week. We pretty much followed his suggestions to the letter, and saw so many wonderful animals (bison, elk, a wonderful moose and a bald eagle, coyotes, etc., etc.) as well as other attractions. The Tetons themselves were not overly clear on either day - we wondered if forest fires much further away might be creating the haze, but they were glorious nonetheless. Would definitely recommend a visit here!

The mountains are clearly majestic. The tops were cloud covered the day we drove by, but there were many pull-offs tor picture taking. The Buffalo were right were they are supposed to be and there was a lot of summer road repair going on, no place to be in a hurry.

We didn't camp at the park but enjoyed the vistas that were many and varied. The scenery was spectacular and the Aspen tress were beginning to change color. The water and the peaked mountain range were gorgeous.

We had just been to Yellowstone the day before (liked it, didn't love it - Old Faithful was worth the trip, but the experience was kind of otherworldly) and hoped that the Grand Tetons wouldn't be a letdown. Ha! Far from it. They are exceptional - beautiful, majestic, awe-inspiring - the superlatives just keep coming. We visited from the Southern entrance and went up to Jackson Lake and then back down to Jenny Lake - this will now be my new happy place. It is clean and absolutely beautiful. The backdrop is the Tetons themselves and you can rent canoes and truly get back to nature. I will be back.

Many people make the mistake of overlooking Grand Teton National Park in favor of its more famous nearby cousin, Yellowstone. Those people are missing out on rugged, natural beauty balanced by a daily wildlife parade. Labor Day was the perfect time to watch the bears at work on the berry bushes along Moose-Wilson road. As a tip, buy your bear spray at the visitor's center. The spray is a neccesary safety measure for anyone taking the gorgeous lake hikes and it's much cheaper than the spray sold in nearby Teton Village or Jackson.

We saw lots of bears on this trip and my teenage son really was impacted by getting out in nature. We drove in from the gate bear Teton Village and headed to Jenny Lake. We hiked the path from the Jenny Lake visitor center to the water-very accessible to people of all physical copies ditions as the lake is just a few feet from the trail. We took some amazing photos. Charge to get into the park is $35 per car and the pass lasts for 7 days.
review_title: Must see this and take your kids

review_body: Breathtaking views. Make sure you take a rafting trip. See animals and birds. There is also an elk preserve that is supposed to be worth seeing. We didn't have the time.

I could not find a suitable word to describe how surprised I was when I experienced such gorgeous landscape. There is blue sky, green trees, clear water and snowy peaks, just like many other scenic places, but it's totally different here. Just stop and take a deep breath, to appreciate the stunning beauty.
What a beautiful sight to see in the distance as you drive. You know there is a higher power at work.
We spent an entire day driving through and stopping at every scenic area. Even though we didn't get to see a lot of wildlife, it was worth it. We took over 400 pictures and could have taken more.

One of those places you simply have to experience to appreciate it. Stunning landscape - flat plain and then steep, jagged mountains rising to snowy peaks - secluded lakes, aspen trees, waterfalls, rivers, bears, deer. There's nothing like this anywhere else I have been. Ideal side trip of a few days before/after Yellowstone.

There is something about the Tetons that I have never experienced any place else on earth, and I have been blessed to have seen a lot of places. I feel that if God had a mountain house, it would be in the Tetons. I also feel overwhelmed by their beauty in all seasons. Only a divine power could have created something that beautiful. Most people go to that location to see Yellowstone National Park. While it is also a treasure, nothing compares to the Tetons. The float trip down the Snake River inside Grand Teton National Park is a remarkable experience. Riding a horse in the Tetons comes next. If I were very wealthy, I would take everyone I love to this remarkable place. It is truly a national treasure. Put a visit to the Tetons on your bucket list.

The Tetons are a "young" mountain range - about 10 million years old. Their creation caused the Jackson Valley to sink thus "Jackson Hole". Grand Teton is the tallest peak of the Teton Mountain Range. The peaks of the Tetons are stunning and memorable because they have not been dulled by the elements and erosion. Each is unique and has a name - Grand Teton, Cathedral Group, and Teton Glacier as examples. No matter the time of day or weather conditions, the Tetons are a dramatic reminder of Nature's Grandeur. Just 10 miles from Jackson WY, and 50 miles from Yellowstone, Grand Teton National Park is ideally located for the adventurous traveler.

You'd be hard pressed to find more compact, Alpiine garandeur in the US than the Grand Tetons (well, maaybe parts of glacier National Park could give the Tetons a run for the money).Jagged peaks, big sky, mountain-top snow fields, and Jackson Lake combine to provide the visitor with spectacular scenery, true "eye candy" of the scenic type. The nearby airport and major highways make theis an easily accessible, though remote, park.Like its neighbor to the north, Yellowstone NP, the Tetons host a variety of wildlife with the added benefit of a world class ski resort. This is one heck of a place to visit.
review_title: Grand Teton National Park - an Alpine spectacle in the US

review_body: The many animal siteings throughout the park. We've seen an elk, mule deer, pronghorn & a coyote along Teton Park road. So many easy hikes. Visit for two weeks if you can.

The Tetons were named "Grande" for a reason. One of my favorite places on the planet. If you didn't fly into Jackson Hole and drove from the west into town, nothing equals the thrill of seeing the Tetons for the first time as you round the hill from town and towards the airport. If you don't pull off at one of the turn outs to enjoy the moment, you are missing a special time.
Toured last week in Sep. Light crowds but still warm weather. Check out the review of the Grand Teton loop. Good recommendations. Then head to Jackson for dinner and shopping.

We spent five days at Grand Teton National Park, and only touched the surface of everything to see and do. The awesome views of the mountains were clouded by smoke from western wildfires by the time we left the Park and I hope that visitors that did not experience the views on a clear day can come back. In addition to the loop roads that make viewing easy, and offer lots of photo ops, visits to Jenny Lake and Signal Mountain should not be missed. Take the boat across Jenny Lake. Caution on the short trail to see the waterfall if your knees give you trouble. The trail is rocky and steep enough to feel it the next day (and the next...). Learning about the plight of the glaciers and the effect of climate change already cataloged makes a trip to see our USA natural wonders so important.
review_title: Awesome views no matter where you look!

review_body: An awe inspiring destination. Great place for tours, hiking, bicking, mountain climbing, rafting, kiacking, wildlife, bird watching, photography, and more. Equal to Grand Canyon. A must see!
Don't miss this park and Yellowstone. Both are breathtakingly spectacular. Our favorite activity was the early morning boat trip to Elk Island which included a nice breakfast including trout.

What a mountain range, what views, what photograph opportunities. This was a stunning drive from Yellowstone National Park to Jackson. Too many stops needed to take pictures and marvel at the views. Worth the visit.
We visited and attended a service at the Chapel of the Transfiguration. Gorgeous view. We saw mother Moose and baby calf feeding in a stream and numerous antelope and some elk. Photographers dream!

Scenery is so beautiful in photos, being in the middle of it all is indescribable!!! Driving, walking hiking or just sitting still--there's no escaping the beauty. Around every turn on the road was a great view. We couldn't keep up with taking photos. Take a drive on Signal Mountain-- the vista is beautiful. We hiked a few trails including one in Paintbrush Canyon up to Holly Lake, 9410 feet above see level. We walked through woods, over small creeks, up rocky paths and past Alpine meadows to a glacial lake all in one hike. In every moment there was something new to see. It took 5 hours up and 3 down. The views were outstanding. But like I said, you will see beauty whether you hike for 8 hours , drive around the beautiful lakes and mountains or just sit and take it all in! Aaah...
Grand Teton mountain peaks are truly awesome. If you need to plan to see, this should be on your bucket list. You won't be disappointed.

Extraordinary Natural Wonder of Western Hemisphere. Check out the Grand Tetons versus the Andes. Jackson Hole sells way more alcohol than Peru. Okay, if you are transcendental, the Mountains will speak to you. I actually saw a family meditating beside a cascade. If you are not going to the Alps in Switzerland, the USA Grand Tetons is the top of the cake. Totally life-changing.
Grand Teton Nation Park is breathtaking. The peaks are spectacular and the valley is filled with wildlife and historic sites from the early settler days. Bring a camera
Charming little chapel at the base of the Grand Tetons. Beautiful views of the Grand Tetons. Highly recommend you stop and check it out if you are in the area!
review_title: Chapel of the Transfiguration, Grand Teton National Park

review_body: One of the highlights of our "out West" vacation. Beautiful snow capped mountains make a beautiful backdrop for any photo that you take. We enjoyed the quiet and breath taking views. Plus, you have easy access to Yellowstone or Jackson Hole!
review_title: Grand Teton is da bomb diggity!

review_body: The mountains are rugged and dramatic. Don't miss the gondola ride from Teton Village. (Be dressed for the cold, even in summer.) The altitude making hiking a bit difficult for me, but we meandered around for hours, awestruck by the views. Grand Teton National Park is not to be missed, but its one dramatic feature dominates the park, in comparison to Yellowstone, which has many fascinating destinations, each quite different from the others.

Purple mountain's majesty? This must be where they got that from. Someone must have looked out the window of his car or from the lodge, saw that and could help but burst into song. There they are - purple mountains in all their majesty!
review_title: From the mountains to the prairies...

review_body: My fav place to go. You just can not beat the magnificent views of the Tetons. There is so much to do and see...We like to go in the fall..........you see much more wildlife and the trees are changing. The weather is just perfect that time of year. If I never go anywhere else but here, I will be a happy camper!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The mountains and scenery here are spectacular! Took so many photos as we drove around. Saw lots of wildlife as well.

We loved Grand Teton. Stunning scenery and so easy to get around without the crowds of Yellowstone. We enjoyed the history of the place especially the Murie Center and Laurence S. Rockefeller Preserve

We brought our bikes and rode from Jenny Lake to Jackson for lunch. Overall it was 42 miles on well-maintained, scenic bike trail. I wish Yellowstone would get with the program and put in some bike zones.
Drove into the park close to sunset on our way home from Yellowstone and went to the lake area. Very pretty and worth the extra time it took us.

There are not enough positive words in the dictionary to describe how wonderful this place is. The beauty is absolutely breathtaking!There are many opportunities to see the wildlife that lives in the area, countless spots to watch the sunrise or sunset, and plenty of areas to hike around for some peace and quite. It is a little less peaceful and quite along the major roads and during or after the motorcycle rally in Sturgis, SD. It does take quite awhile to get from one side of the park to another as there are only a few main roads, so leave plenty of time in your plans for travel. Plus, you never know when you'll see something that you'll want to take a picture of.

GORGEOUS mountains..incredible views. Try to get into the mountains to hike to lovely alpine lakes and water falls. Some of the best hikes were around the lakes (Coulter Bay on Jackson Lake, around Jenny Lake, and my favorite which was String lake. My favorite hike of all was Taggard Lake. Tough to find a reasonable place to stay; lodging is very expensive in the park (which is 45 min from Jackson, the nearest town). Camping inside the park is good, but we stayed at the Coulter Bay campground, which had nice sites but HORRIBLE bathrooms (the sinks in the womens bathroom had a facet with cold water that you had to hold to keep the water on...no hooks or pegs or shelves to set anything down. Ditto for the area to wash dishes - not a table/shelf or anything to put down what you've cleaned. It'd be a simple fix if they would/could do something about this)
The towering Grand Tetons are something to see, and the 42 mile loop road is a nice, leisure drive. Be sure to see Mormon Row while there.
Sweeping landscapes, amazing mountains. a photographers delight! A wonderful place to spend a holiday.
Preferred the view of these mountains. We visited the visitor's center and took great photos from the road heading towards Jackson.

We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay in the Park at Signal Mountain Lodge. Our cabin overlooked the lake and we managed to do some star gazing at night as it was so clear. The cabin was basic but clean and comfortable enough. The staff were great too. Sadly our stay was marred as we left our back-pack by Jenny Lake one afternoon and when we went back to get it, it had already been taken. Unfortunately, whoever had taken it decided they liked it and didn't bother handing it in. They obviously had a slither of kindness in them as they removed our phones and left them on a table in a completely different location. Some very kind person found them and handed them in. (If you ever read this review - thank you!) All the staff we spoke to around the park were so helpful in trying to locate the back-pack. We were eventually contacted by a volunteer from the Lost and Found team who told us the phones had been handed in. They arranged to forward them to our hotel for us to collect on our last night in the US. Thank you so much for this. We left Grand Teton feeling very fed up due to the loss of the backpack and its contents, however, the helpfulness of the staff really cheered us up and we can now look back on our stay here with very fond memories. It is a beautiful place and well worth a visit.
review_title: Beautiful place and excellent service from the Lost & Found team!

review_body: I have always wanted to see the Tetons and the park lived up to my expectations. The signage is great, there is something for everyone to do. Weather in August is delightful. Our only disappointment was the hazy sky due to forest fires very far away. Can't control that. If you are thinking of going, go!
Wonderful area. Loved it all. Nice folks and eager to help. I would stay in this area rather than Jackson. All is walkable in village.

This park is fantastically beautiful. Right smack in your face beautiful. There are plenty of places to pull off and enjoy the scenery. Nothing is too far to see. Be sure and go to Jenny Lake. The scenic boat ride is well worth whatever it costs and the hour out of your day.

Recently I organized a group boat camping trip in Grand Teton NP and had many questions about boat permits, camping, parking, etc. I visited the Moose Visitor Center 3 times to gather information and pickup the permits. Each time Ranger Bobbie Tumolo helped with our arrangements. She was very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly so ask for her if you want the best service.

Some of the most stunning scenery I have ever seen. Went as part of at our group and having a guide meant we were given good information on the best parts of park to visit. Lots of walking/ hiking involved so appropriate shoes a must.We only had a half day visit which was definitely not enough to see everything .

Grand Teton was beautiful. The National Park was breath taking. We saw Bison, Moose, Owl, Elks, but no bears. The lakes were crystal clear and not too cold to swim. We tent camped but Jackson hole downtown was just perfect distance to dine for dinner. Elevation is over 6,000 at camp site so the temperature is little cold in the morning. This is definitely a place to visit to see beautiful nature.

If you are looking for the resort experience with all the amenities: biking, hiking, climbing, swimming, wildlife observing, tent-camping, cabins or hotel...Grand Tetons National Park has it all and more.It has tent sites, cabins, RV's and hook-ups. Restaurant and cafe food is as good as any I've eaten in the big city or at a fast-food chain.And if you want to visit Yellowstone, it is a short drive North to the entrance.
review_title: Two Weeks in the Grand Tetons

review_body: The Grand Tetons are one of the most recognizable, and picturesque mountain ranges to see. I had seen pictures of them throughout my life, but seeing them in person was truly amazing. When I first arrived at the park it was very overcast and cloudy; the mountains were partially obscured and had an almost haunted look. Later after the clouds departed, the mountains contrasted against the crisp blue sky really took on their stunning look I had expected. Tons of activities, trails, and other things to do in the park. Read up on wildlife before exploring and take precautions; there are bears and even grizzlies in the area.I'll review some hikes & activities I did in the individual TA entries for Grand Teton NP, but for the park as a whole, it's a must see!

The mountains are breath-taking, but they are serious about bears. Everywhere you go are signs warning you about the bears and if you go swimming at String Lake, there are plenty of metal cabinets to store your food. Having said that, I did not see any bears In fact, I didn't see much of any wildlife other than rabbits and birds. However, that may be more due to the time of year. Otherwise, Grand Tetons is gorgeous although I'm not sure how much young children would enjoy it, as there aren't as many activities as, say, Yellowstone. But if you are looking for some of the most breath taking scenery in the US, then Grand Teton lives up to the hype
review_title: Beautiful scenery, but probably not exciting enough for young children

review_body: Beautiful, lots of scenery and wildlife. We enjoyed every minute of it. This is our second trip here and we would definitely go back

We really enjoyed Grand Teton NP. From the moment you see the majestic Tetons, you are mesmerized by their glory. We only had a day and decided the visitor center, Jenny Lake and driving around was the best for our limited time. We enjoyed the info at the visitor center for about 1/2 Bergen headed to Jenny Lake. WOW... Gorgeous. We found a hiking trail around the lake and one that lead us down to the lake where no one was. Very secluded and quiet. The drive around was relaxing and worth it. Enjoy God's beauty....

Rising 7,000+ feet above the valley floor, the Teton's are an amazing sight to behold. The park is typically well run, with a well appointed visitor center at both the North and South ends, with many scenic roads traveling the length of the park. Highly recommend hiking around Jenny Lake and driving to the top of Signal mountain. Don't miss the Chapel of the Transfiguration for the best view from any church in the country!
review_title: Amazing views, great trails to hike, clean and friendly

review_body: Grand Teton National Park was just amazing to see. With two teenagers that saw the big mountains for the first time, the view is just awesome.

We enjoyed both Jackson and the Grand Teton NP. Teton is just such an enjoyable place to visit, it has so much to offer, from outdoor sports, to scenery, to wildlife learning. When night falls there are many stores and restaurants for your to enjoy as well. The great memories have stayed with us since.
Grand Teton National Park is very beautiful,. Amazing scenic Overlooks, The lakes, and Big mountains are breathtaking, worth to visit

The scenery was very beautiful, and the hiking we did was enjoyable, although we didn't do the real strenuous stuff. But the mountains and the lakes are simply breathtaking. But I still think that all in all, the Grand Canyon and Bryce Canyon trump the Grand Tetons.
We enjoyed the the scenic overlooks and information, the Visitors Center at Coulter Bay. The Teton Park road and the oneway loop by Jenny Lake! Maybe next time we can spend more time!

While Yellowstone seems other-worldly, the Tetons provide sheer beauty. The big craggy mountains are gorgeous. The best time to see them is in the morning when the sun is just peaking over the eastern mountains and it seems to highlight the Tetons. In the evenings, the Tetons' details get masked in the shade of the setting sun. Definitely get up early one morning to see the mountains or take an early morning hike.

Everybody knows of and praises Yellowstone Park and for good reason. Yet Grand Teton to its south completes the Yellowstone experience and to many is the superior destination in its own right. Geologically, historically and ecologically, Teton compliments Yellowstone so perfectly that one park is not complete without the other. This is missed by those visiting Ynp only from the north, west or east.That being said, Teton pleases with grandeur unique to itself and to many even more movingly than in any other place on earth.
review_title: Every bit the equal of Yellowstone or greater

review_body: Whether you are driving toward Yellowstone after leaving Jackson Hole, or leaving Yellowstone headed toward Jackson, be sure to take the cutoff that runs through the middle of Grand Teton NP. The views of Jenny Lake are well worth the side trip. Yellowstone has a unique flavor, but the views of the Tetons across Jenny Lake are wonderful.
review_title: More spectacular than Yellowstone...in my opinion.

review_body: We always go through the south entrance to Grand Teton to get to Yellowstone, This time we had a lot of vacation time and explored Grand Teton Park, The Park has numerous back roads that are car friendly and picnic heavens. We also took the Grand Teton Lodge Company's dinner cruise to Elk Island. I enjoyed the crew, especially our host; Annalesa, and the dinner was on the better side of so-so. Be aware however, there is no awing or cover at the picnic tables (Although the crew sat under an erected tarp)and you eat dinner in the direct sunlight. I imagine the Park disallows building on the island but this exposure would be hard on the elderly or the very young so take a large hat. Coulter Bay campground is first rate if you can find a spot. We found the diesel prices to be cheaper than any other city in Wyoming. Thank you National Park System for doing such a nice job!
If you want to see heaven on earth come here! Jagged peaks of the youngest moutain range in the world that will make you awestruck!

There is something fabulous about this park. I could look at the Mountains all day . We visited Jackson Lake, Jenny Lake, & Colter Bay. Colter has old pioneer cabins. We only stayed there one night. It is no frills. The restaurant on property was good & had items to please everyone. You can walk to waters edge. Boat rentals there & the view is priceless. Lake & Tetons. Gorgeous. Really worth a stop. Walking trails along the lake. There is a good visitors center at Colter with tons of information to plan adventures near. You do not need a pricey tour. They are a waste of money. If seeking animals. Ask the entry rangers. They know where animals have been spotted. Look for groups stopping & pointing. Usually an animal has been spotted. Have an amazing time. This is a trip I would do again. Love this place!!

I prefer the Teton's to Yellowstone overall. Just so scenic to look at. We weren't able to do any hiking this trip, but did enjoy a boat rental on Jackson Lake, and just watching the sun set over the mountains.

Our second trip here. We were happily occupied helping with our daughters wedding. What a spectacular backdrop and church for a wedding. The area is so beautiful and there is so much to see and take in, it can be a long list on our return trips.

Get out and enjoy Grand Teton. There is so much to see and do. We hiked, swam, fished, kayaked, viewed the animals, and drove picture perfect roads with stunning views. We spent 3 days here and we could easily have stayed for 3 more. Especially if you like to hike.
You can't miss with Grand Teton. So many activities and the views are amazing from anywhere near the park. Jackson is a great town. Can't wait to come back for skiing!

We visited and stayed within Grand Teton NP at Jackson Lake Lodge after visiting Yellowstone NP on July 18th. The weather was overcast and misty weather so the Teton Mountain range was covered with clouds, however, the following morning at sunrise offered breaks in clouds and sunrays touching the slopes of the snow capped peaks. Very scenic area that is awe-inspiring! Observed elk in the meadows and bald eagle soaring low over the waters of Jackson Lake. A must visit to see!

Gorgeous place; the Teton Mountains are stunningly beautiful, and one of the best places to relax and enjoy the view is at Dornan's in Moose. You can sit on the deck, have a soda or beer, eat pizza and have the Grand Teton staring you in the face, all overlooking the Snake River. Visitor Center is also at Moose, a modern facility where you can get information on hiking, fishing, climbing or anything else you want to do in the park.
review_title: Awesome park, fishing, hiking, better than Yellowstone

review_body: Just drove through the valley and definitely regret that we didn't plan more time to spend over there. Jackson is a must visit town!

Grand Tetons is one of my favorite National Parks. So much to do between the lakes, biking, hiking. The kids loved the lakes, swimming and boating. We took a fun bike tour. The hiking was for all levels. We even had a professional photographer take family pictures in front of Moulton Barn.
review_title: Absolutely beautiful. Great Lakes, activities, hiking, etc.

review_body: This area is stunning and is overlooked because of Yellowstone. Absolutely beautiful and diverse. We saw a female grizzly with two cubs off of the side of the road. Many elk and pronghorn.

What a great combo! We started off with Grand Teton and it was beautiful! There are breathtaking vistas everywhere. So much to do and see. While we were touring GT, we stayed in Driggs, Idaho. Driggs is just over the mountain and much more budget friendly than Jackson.

No matter where you go, you will always find a fantastic view. Between the unique flora and fauna, and the amazing landscape, I can honestly say that I filled countless memory cards on this trip. It definitely made for a one-of-a-kind vacation

What an amazing park! We started the loop going through Teton village, through antelope flats and exiting into Jackson. We got a very early start and saw A LOT of wildlife....moose, bison, pronghorn. We stopped at Jenny Lake to take in the view. The loop took us almost 4 hours and that was taking our time. This can't be missed. We enjoyed it more than Yellowstone.

Visited in August. Weather during our trip was perfect. 70s during the day, and sunny so shorts were perfect attire. Had a senior with us so we got a senior pass from the visitor center. Saved us a lot of money as a senior pass is $10 for a lifetime pass and a typical carload charge can be upwards of $50. So make sure to get your park pass. Well worth it. Pays for itself in 1 visit. Lots to do here from the Jackson Lake Dam to Jenny Lake crossing by boat (NOT ACCESSIBLE so bear that in mind if you take the shuttle boat across). Set aside a whole day. If you plan to hike you probably need a couple of days. Don't miss at least a drive through this beautiful place.
review_title: Beautiful Views and a picnic spot for all.

review_body: Great escape from big city. Good hiking trails specially inspiration point and hidden falls across Jenny lake. Near Yellowstone and Teton village and Jackson. Did see lot of wildlife bison, elks, Moose, bear, gophers, ospreys, bald eagle and deers.
The Grand Tetons rise up from the earth without foothills, making them all the more spectacular. We rode bicycles on the bike path, which really us feel like we were part of the environment.
This National Park is so beautiful. We had an opportunity to see bison, elk, and two bald eagles. There is a lot of driving, but it is all very scenic.

I'm an east coast girl and never saw mountains to speak of other than a few visits to Estes Park in Colorado and Bear Mountain in N.Y - these were amazing! Crystal clear skies and beautiful cloud formations as a backdrop! Lots of history here too with John D. Rockefeller credited with protecting this area from commercial exploitation. Our beautiful natural landscape will have to be protected in the future in national parks like this from greedy developers.
review_title: Breathtaking Views of Mountains and Wilderness In the Good Old USA

review_body: Traveling to the Grand Teton National Park is one of the thrills of my traveling experience. I found the setting breathtaking and I don't mean due to the altitude. The vistas were absolutely stunning, bar none. At first, I felt like a kid in a toy shop! Which way to turn next??? Whether I was at the bottom of the mountain range looking up or near the top of a mountain looking down, the site before me was awesome .. and that is using the word in its true sense. I was in awe!! I also faced the notion that I really am rather insignificant in the total scheme of things. The majesty of the vista also caused me to want some time 'off to the side' for a bit to contemplate life and those things that really matter and those that are frivolous. From now on when I hear God Bless America's line 'From the mountains," I will be picturing the Tetons.
It is breath-taking to stand on a lake shore and gaze across the water at the pyramid peaks laced with glaciers. Teton is incredible.
review_title: Living in a picture for a moment

review_body: LOVED this National Park. There is so many great things to see and do here. The views are breath-taking and there are many great trails to hike. If you like to bike, there are biking paths, fishing places, great stops along the way to take pictures.
review_title: Grand Teton - a wonderful place to visit!

review_body: Fantastic one day in-and-out hike for the adventurous, but not hardcore. You will need only stamina and desire to make the 7+ mile round trip hike out to Alaska Basin past Phelps Lake. It is a well maintained trail with excellent views and a wide variety of landscapes to enjoy. Highly Recommended!
We had a nice stay at Grand Teton. Take 2 or 3 days at Teton and then head over to Yellowstone. Jenny Lake is really crowded though, try one of the other trails.

Grand Teton was on the way to Yellowstone and we thought 1.5 days would suffice. Wrong. Turns out we enjoyed the Grand Tetons more than Yellowstone and wished we could have spent at least another full day to do more hiking. Grand Teton seemed less crowded, had fewer cars, and traffic flowed much better than at Yellowstone. A volunteer based in Jackson suggested the Taggart-Bradley Lakes hike which is 6 miles round-trip. Most hikers go to Taggart Lake first and then would have to hike UP the switchbacks to get to Bradley Lake, but the ranger advised us that at the first fork, take the trail to Bradley Lake so that we would be hiking DOWN the switchbacks to Taggart Lake. What a difference that made!!! He also suggested that we begin our hike early in the day because the parking lot and trails get crowded. He was right!

Spent two days there on our way up to yellowstone and should have stayed longer! We hear a lot more about Grand Teton's book ends - Jackson Hole to the south and Yellowstone to the north - but GT steals the show. With a fraction of the crowds rolling through Yellowstone and vertical views like nowhere else in the US, the Grand Tetons are a MUST for anyone who loves our national parks. It's easily accessible from the town of Jackson and offers great hikes, fishing, boating and camping.

Lovely experience - beautiful views of a changing landscape. The lakes (particularly the smaller ones) are charming. Good wild life viewing - all in an area that is much more compact than Yellowstone and far less crowded

Beautiful country. Impressive views of the mountains. A must see on your way or from Yellowstone National Park. This was our second time. First time we booked a solitude float tour on Snake River. It was awesome! So much to see in the Tetons. Jenny Lake is a must as well. Very pretty. Serene.
A great national park, surpassing Yellowstone in terms of hiking and views. Dozens of great walks all with killer views of the Tetons.

We took a 4 day family trip to the Grand Tetons and Yellowstone National Parks. After reading many reviews I thought we had allowed enough time to see everything without making it so long that the kids would get bored. I have to say, we were not ready to end the trip when we had to leave. There is so much to do in the Grand Teton National park area that we didn't get to do. It would have been great to rent bikes and ride on the bike trails, rent a boat on Jenny Lake, do more hikes in the area, horseback ride around the area. We were there mainly to see animals for the kids, which we saw plenty. But if we go back I think I would focus less on seeing the animals and more on experiencing some much needed downtime in one of the most beautiful areas of the world. You really don't have to look for the wildlife, they are there naturally in everything you do. They are like the icing on the cake of a wonderful outdoor vacation in nature. It's definitely a trip I feel we have to do again.
review_title: There is SO much to do in Grand Teton National Park!

review_body: Mind blowing views unequaled anywhere in my history. We loved being here and seeing the mountains everywhere we went. We took a boat ride around the lake which was very informative as well as beautiful. My only feeling of shortcomings was that we as older travelers can not do many of the hikes that are necessary to fully appreciate this park.

Less known that it's neighbour - Yellowstone - is much less crowded and certainly worth a trip. The geology is amazing and since it is much less crowded, you have more chance to spot the wildlife. Great visitors' centers infrastructure and activities with rangers. Just wish we've had more time do do some climbing... It seems it is amazing in winter too.
Amazing backdrop. Unfortunately, did not see much wildlife. Beautiful lakes. Quieter than YNP. Good for a 1-2 day trip

Those mountains just grow in front of you without any natural barrier to block the view, there are glaciers on the tops and highest peak is over 4000m, seems like great place for climbing in Alipne style. I recommend to take a park road and drive close to the mountains this does not take much more time than main road and you are much closer, binoculars are also fun to use here to look at the ridge and try to find climbers there. You have a chance to see a Moose or Elk as we did. We just drove through it on the way from Yellowstone to Salt Lake City after morining sightseeing in Y it is on the way and made a perfect day.

We loved grand Teton,it has stunning views at almost every turn. Plenty of opportunities to go off on side roads to do your own thing. Hiking & cycling is very popular.We liked that it is a lot less crowded than Yellowstone with no queuing to enter the park, it took us 1.5 hours to enter Yellowstone v 5 minutes for Grand Teton. And no queuing for restrooms either.We saw eagles, mooose & stunning scenery before the weather turned into a tremendous rain storm. Even then the cloud gathering against the Teton mountains was beautiful
The Grand Teton mMountains are absolutely breathtaking. It is hard to take your eyes off of them. We truly enjoyed seeing them.

We stayed in Jackson for two days when we approached Yellowstone from the South entrance and were lucky to see Grand Teton each time. The views are just gorgeous. We pulled off on a number of scenic overlooks just to sit/stand and admire the views.
The views were awe inspiring! Not as large as Yellowstone; however, very pretty. My wife, granddaughter, and I tool a calm float trip and it was fabulous.
The Tetons are beyond beautiful. We saw a lot of animals and the signage was excellent. Great weather. Don't miss it. The drive is great. Many things to stop and see.

Right outside of Jackson a little ways is Snake River Overlook, and you do not want to miss it. It offers a stunning view of the Grand Tetons and is our favorite place to stop of pictures. We were here back in 2011 and again this year, and it never gets old. The park itself is great and the Tetons are outstanding. You don't want to miss this.
The most beautiful views I have ever seen in my life! No way you can go to the Jackson area and not be affected by the beauty of these mountains that surround you.
Awesome place! The snow capped mountains are majestic soaring with jagged peaks up to the sky. Toward mid day the mist began to fade. Wished we spent more time here!

We like out of the way places, and two oceans lake was a good one. Moderately easy 6.4 mile hike completely around the lake was a good one. Not many other people, beautiful fields of wild flowers and we saw several moose in the lake. Bring long pants and bug spray.

Grand Teton National Park is a great place to visit. The last time I was there was in the summer of 2014... we went to Yellowstone National Park and Grand Teton in early July of 2014 and had a great time there.

We love this park. If you like the smell of sulfur and waiting for bison and cars to cross visit Yellowstone. Then when you are ready for real natural beauty. Come on down to the Tetons. Take the ferry across Jenny Lake to Hidden Falls and you will ask why anyone would go to the other park. Great to do's: float down the Snake River, kayak though OxBow ponds, canoe across Jackson Lake. Hikes: Moose Ponds, Inspiration Point, Phelps Lake, or Cascade and Hanging Canyon ( if you are in shape).
review_title: So much natural beauty and wildlife.

review_body: We only got to spend one night and one day driving and hiking around Grand Teton Park. We did get off on a side road and came upon a large herd of bison - fun stuff. The park offers many stops and leads into Yellowstone so it worked out perfectly.
review_title: Beauty everywhere - incredible mountains and easy drive

review_body: This is a unique park because the peaks rise dramatically and very sharply from the valley floor. We thought the park was very well maintained and visits to the visitor centers were very helpful. While in the park we saw at close range grizzly bears, black bears, moose, elk and other wildlife.
review_title: 2015 Vist to Grand Teton National Park

review_body: This is a stunning park which should not be missed. The views are stunning everywhere you look. Enough areas to pull off the road to more relaxed viewing. Camp sites a bit expensive.

Just make a list of all the superlative adjectives you can think of, and you've described the scenery of the Tetons. The crowds and traffic were a fraction of the horror that was Yellowstone, and we enjoyed a great day.

This National Park is stunning. The views are spectacular. The mountains are just amazing. Lots of opportunities to see wildlife along the road as well as on a float down the Snake River. Moose Rd is a must. Lots of wildlife on it around dusk. This park is a must see. Good for all ages.

This is not a crowded park. I think everyone goes to Yellowstone. I strongly suggest going to this park too if you plan on going to Yellowstone. The Grand Tetons are beautiful. Take the full hike or the boat over to the hidden falls. It is worth it. Go to Signal mountain road. We drov right by the first stop thinking nothing was there. Stop there and walk the path and go a little further. It is worth it.
Fantastic scenery and wildlife all around. Beautiful lakes and mountains. I highly recommend spending a few days here.

The views of the mountains, and of Jenny Lake are wonderful! We took some beautiful pictures here. The Snake river flows by the mountains and we took a float trip down the river, and enjoyed a picnic lunch on the raft. From here we were able to see the mountains and some wildlife. A very enjoyable, relaxing afternoon float!
We just drove by on our way down south yet it was a majestic views and vistas. I won't mind making another trip if I lived nearby

We drove the road loop from Jackson inside the Teton road,to see the mountains from the side and then approaching them was breathtaking.We stopped along the way each time there was a scenic point or a trail that we could handle.our highlight is Jackson lake

Whilst being busy (especially Jenny Lake) the Tetons are amazing. If you have never seen a 13700ft mountain, then here is a spectacular one. We saw bears, loads of elk and bison, pronghorn and beavers. You shouldn't visit Yellowstone and miss out the Tetons
Fantastic views of the mountains. We had a lovely weather, so we were completely impressed. The Grand Tetons are breathtaking.

Visited in July...recommend seeing the more popular parts of the park and shorter hikes early in the day, because it gets busy. There wasn't any parking at Jenny Lake between about 11 and 4. Spectacular beauty!! Such an awe inspiring place.

Most incredible scenery I have ever seen! Take or rent something to ride the off-road trails, you get a perspective not everyone sees. Would spend time here over Yellowstone. The park is smaller, the scenery more beautiful, and animal population/experience is better (the park is smaller, so there is a better chance of having an encounter). Would go back in a heart beat and stay longer!
take your time and enjoy the drive. the tetons are pretty. make sure to hit the restrooms when you get the chance. lol. take time to enjoy the lake and the mountains in the background.

My favorite park so far. I actually enjoy it more the Yellowstone. The layout and setup of the park are almost 'man made' perfect haha. The mountains are very unique and provide a constant beautiful backdrop almost everywhere in the park,
A beautiful National park with stunning views of the Grand Tetons, beautiful hiking trails, wildlife viewing opportunities, great for photography, outdoor adventurers, rafting the Snake River.

Jagged snow capped mountains were so beautiful. Pictures are awesome, but to be there and see the entire pallet of colors is breathtaking. Although Yellowstone is unique in its terrain, Grand Teton is just as beautiful in a dramatic way. The mountains against lakes and forrest is like nothing else. We also saw a wolf in one of the grassy areas as we were leaving the park early evening. This is a must see if you are in the area.
We found the Tetons to be georgous, especially while floating10 miles on the Black River. The Jackson Hole area was populated with Bald Eagles, some moose and bear.
Enjoyed the dramatic views of the Grand Teton mountain range from different spots and altitudes. It's a photographer's dream.

This is a great park for being outdoors. Take advantage of all levels of hiking. Stop first at the Visitor Center to know what is open, types of trails, outdoor events as boating, ranger talks.There is something for every level.

I love this place, so much to see and do, and so beautiful, a lesser known spot than Yellowstone but absolutely worth the extra 90 miles south. You can visit this place lavishly or on a budget, either way the views are the same, and if you end up camping you are really immersed in the natural beauty such as an Elk beside your tent when you wake up.
review_title: So close to Yellowstone but lesser known, but worth a detour as very different.

review_body: The view of the mountains from the loop road were just...well, I was speechless. We also saw moose at Moose Junction.

Had just a day to explore the park and it's surroundings. Used to drive the loop, seeing Jenny and Jackson lakes. Great photo opportunities all around, an impressive mountain range similar to the Alps in Europe. And if you are taking your time you will most likely see wildlife - we saw Bisons and Elks in the norther area of Jackson Lake. Great and fun day all around.
Coming out of Texas we always look forward to the coolness of the Tetons. We stayed a Lake Jackson Lodge and was satisfied with the location and the room.

We drove through on our way out Yellowstone and was not disappointed. The views of the mountains, the lakes, and forests was unbelievable. We stopped and had a picnic lunch on Jackson Lake along with a swim for the kids. It was a setting I've never had before and it was stunning. We also hiked around Jenny Lake which was very nice. It seems like around every turn you want to stop to take a picture and enjoy the view. Although we had a great time it would have been nice to stay all night and enjoy a little more.

We loved Grand Teton National Park and recommend the hikes in the less traveled areas. Go to the visitor center (we observed a fox here taking a mole) and ask the very informative staff about the best places to go. They will send you to places many folks do not visit.
Stayed in Jackson for 2 days. Took Float trip down Snake River with the majestic Tetons ever present. Drove around Jenny Lake - one of the most picturesque lakes ever. Highly recommend a visit.
There are no mountains that compare to the Tetons. This is the most beautiful mountain range anywhere in the world, might not be the tallest but for me, nothing compares! A must see for sure!

beautiful place to camp and hike! love, love, love the mountains no matter where you are, there they are. a lot of wild life.. ground squirrels, black bears, grizzly bears, chipmunks etc. so much to do! could spend an entire week there!

After spending 5 days in Yellowstone, made the long...drive to Tetons! ( we were staying in West Yellowstone) Well worth the drive! The jagged peaks w/glaciers on them were beautiful. Took the shuttle boat across Jenny Lake to go see waterfall. Nice short hike to the falls. Wish we would have had more time to do some of the other hikes. Would definitely recommend that you go here.
Beautiful mountains and sites to see. Plenty of picnic areas. Drove through after visiting Yellowstone

there is not a bad view or time. raining, may see a rainbow. sunrise...unbelievable. sunset...unbelievable. make sure to do a float trip and you will get the best pictures possible. this was not an animal viewing experience as much as it was pure natural beauty. could look at that every day

After all day in Yellowstone made the drive to the Tetons! Just more scenic views of lakes and wildlife. It was well worth the drive. Stopped so many times to just smell the fresh air and enjoy watching the foxes play.
Lovely snow capped mountains, even in June. A landscape very similar to the jagged peaks of the Alps. A complete and welcome contrast to the rolling plains in much of Wyoming.
Be sure to go on either the breakfast lake cruise to Elk Island or the evening dinner cruise around the lake. We liked it all.

Well, probably I am biased because I am from the north of Italy and I am used to Dolomites and Alps in general, but these famous mountains are so spectacular to me.I mean, they are cool, but nothing compared to european mountains. It's a nice place for outdoor life lovers and great for bbq too!
review_title: Nice peaks but nothing compared to european mountains

review_body: The Tetons are absolutely beautiful. We went for a few quick hikes and also stopped several times around the lake. The mountains are gorgeous from any angle.

The snow-topped mountains are beautiful! We drove a lot and stopped a lot to take pictures. The weather was cool..... high 60's to low 70's and the skies were a crystal blue. I would submit a picture but for some reason this area does not allow me to upload.

Travelled throughout park and took severla hiking trails and stops at various locations. Jenny Lake area gorgeous. Take the trail up to Signal Mountain for valley views. View all the animals and nature.

So much beauty in this park. We saw heaps of bison, elk and deer. We even got to see a great horned owl which caused great excitement. The mountains themselves are spectacularly beautiful and I wanted to stay forever. Fabulous park with rugged scenery, beautiful mountains, an abundance of wildlife, gorgeous waterways. What more could you wish for?
review_title: The bison, elk and deer were in abundance.

review_body: We were really impressed with the views and the scenic driving. We spent a couple of days and saw some of the main attractions. The glacier covered mountain tops in the middle of summer make for some great photos. We did not see hardly any wildlife unfortunately. We saw one fox and that was about it. There was way less traffic here when compared to Yellowstone. Stop at Jenny Lake and Jackson Lake to enjoy some great views and walk around. Jackson Lake has a beautiful rock beach that you can wander around.

The Grand Tetons are a wonderful place to visit. The scenery is beautiful. The mountains remind me of the Swiss Alps, but there are far less of them. The lakes are wonderful to look at especially if you can get a photo with a reflection of the mountains. Lots of animals to see. The Snake River adds to the enjoyment. This is MUCH smaller than Yellowstone. The park can be toured in about a day. If you want to add some activities like a float trip or white water trip, add another day or two. Restaurants in the area are generally average to above average with a few exceptions (both ways). Prices are above average.The views in the Grand Teton National Park are not as varied as Yellowstone. There are no thermal areas, no Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and no lodges in the park in various locations (as in Yellowstone). So.... although it a a great place to visit, be prepared to be let down if you want to compare it to Yellowstone.
review_title: Wonderful scenery but much more limited than Yellowstone National Park

review_body: We love to do day hikes and this was truly a wonderful place for it. We were in Jackson for 5 nights allow for 4 days/morning hikes that were wonderful and varied. We started with ranger guided tour to Taggart Lake that was a nice intro to the region. Due to cloud cover we did not get a great view of the Tetons that morning, but the hike was still wonderful. Day 2 we when to Jenny Lake and Hidden Falls, taking the boat on the outbound leg and walked back round the lake. Saw 4 bears on this trip! The next day we took the Lookout Rock trail from Jackson Lake Lodge and saw lots of wild life, the view of the Tetons was spectacular. The final day we did String Lake trail which was around a lake at the base of the mountains. Each trip was different revealing more about this wonderful natural treasure.
review_title: We love Grand Teton National Park

review_body: What an amazing set of mountains! We have visited a few different ranges throughout the Rockies and this was by far one of the coolest. Whether your staying in Jackson Hole and only passing them or spending time hiking in the park, its a beautiful place to see. We would recommend doing the 42 Mile(43 on my car) loop from Moose Junction to Jackson Lake Lodge if you have the time. You can do it in about in hour if in a rush or 2-4 if you want to stop often.
review_title: Beautiful Park located between Jackson, Wy and Yellowstone NP.

review_body: How amazing this planet truly is! This park is gorgeous!! And the Tetons are just awesome!!!! July and there was still some left over snow waaaaay up there! The park offers fishing,boating,food,gift shops,gas station and more! Don't miss this place folks! Get your butts out there!:)
Drove by on our trip from Yellowstone to Jackson. Absolutely breathtaking views, would have loved to stay longer.

We just drove through from West Yellowstone headed south to Salt Lake City and beyond. It adds an hour or two driving vice just taking I-15. Figured it would be worth it since we've never seen it. I suppose it was worth it, but not a slam dunk. The mountains are certainly scenic...reminds me of pics I've seen of the Alps. But as a drive-through destination, it's kind of one-note. In Zion, there's something new around every curve. Here, it's pretty much just the same view over and over. Perhaps more exciting if one has the time to get out and hike/boat. As a drive through, it's nice, but borderline call if it's worth adding 1-2 hours to your drive. Actually, found some of the drive exiting Yellowstone and south of Jackson to be almost as "scenically involving".

Spectacular mountains and lakes. We saw the Grand Tetons on the way from Jackson Hole to Yellowstone. We decided the scenery was fantastic and returned the next day and actually entered the park. We were not dissappointed. If you are 62 or over you can get a senior pass for $10 that is a lifetime pass good for all the national parks. They do check your ID and the pass is good for all people in the vehicle, so your spouse or children, friends etc do not need a pass. Otherwise a 7 day pass is $30 or $50 for both the Grand Tetons and Yellowstone. If you are in the area I would recommend getting both passes.

The contrast of the high, snow capped mountains over the lake is beautiful. There is opportunity to see a lot of wild life as well. It is much less crowded than neighboring Yellowstone. Both parks are worth seeing and we could have spent a week in each park easily.

We were anticipating lots of twisting, turning elevated roads, but not so. Leaving the south entrance of Yellowstone to Grand Teton along Lake Jackson. Wonderful bike route into jackson also from the park.
review_title: Beautiful, easy drive from Jackson to Yellowstone

review_body: The Grand Tetons are perhaps the most breathtaking of all the mountains in the US. Everyone should visit. If you can, take the time to hike, perhaps around Jenny Lake. The park staff is very helpful.

Beautiful and less crowded than Yellowstone in July. Parking was aBattle at major trail heads. The visitor center at Craig Thomas is very interesting and just deck sitting there with the view is great. The Snake river float trips are picked up just across the street so visit before or after a ride. It rained on ours but we saw lots of eagles.

This is a beautiful park, but I'm going to review the rest rooms because no one ever does. The restrooms here are still maintained, clean, odor free or fresh smelling and well stocked, including hand sanitizer! So much nicer than any park bathroom in northern California, which were quite smelly and not kept clean. It was such a pleasant surprise not to gag when using the public restrooms in this state park and Yellowstone as well! Congratulations to the park service on this one!

Just visited this national gem. Absolutely beautiful national park 8 miles from Jackson, Wyoming. We were able to see wild animals on every pass through the park. The Grand Tetons are splendid. The view changed every day. Sunrise, sunset, clouds or blue sky made an ever changing background for these majestic mountains. There were beautiful wild flowers, lakes and the Snake River. Can't say enough about Grand Teton National Park. So glad I got to see it!

The Teton's will take your breath away the first time you see them. What beautiful mountains. I was fortunate to see them for 7 days with clear skies every day. Do some hiking and enjoy the wild life.
We rented a SUV and drove through GTNP. The scenery was beautiful. Plenty of pull off for pictures. Drive to the top of Singel Mountain is worth the view.

Grand Teton National Park is a gem of a place to vacation. The campgrounds are beautiful with plentiful facilities. Jenny Lake boat ride and hike is perfect for families, and Jackson Hole is close enough to get in a city feel if needed. Make sure you leave plenty of time to enjoy this National Park if you visit Yellowstone. It is worth the trip.
In contrast to Yellowstone, Tetons have the dramatic mountains, beautiful wildflowers and a moister climate.

The herds of people thinned out while we were in Grand Tetons and it was splendid! We saw herds of hundreds of buffalo, beautiful jagged mountains that are only rising by the day, and a bear a cubs! If I had to choose between Teton and Yellowstone I'd go Teton all the way!

Grand Teton is a beautiful open, rolling fields and meadows to huge, jagged rock mountains. It has a beauty like no other. The grand is an understatement in its name. Many places to pull off and take in the beauty of it. It offers so much nature between the dams built by beavers to the wild flowers blowing in the wind. Walking on flat trails or hiking up towards the hills. Lazy and relaxing or hard core bike rides along the road itself. Rentals are nearby to offer you that experience. Helicopter tours are available to get an up close picture of the peaks. Jackson Hole is the city that is still sinking to this day because of the Grand Tetons. Interesting to read about as you go along the road and stop to read the signs.
The majesty of God's creation! Driving through the "Rockies" up above the clouds - awesome views and wildlife.

This is an iconic park. The backdrop of the Teton Mountains are awesome - tall jagged peaks rising like a curtain in the near distance. There are lakes in the park and some lodging options. We saw much wildlife - grizzleys and elk. There are some nice short hikes, and some longer ones accessed from a short boat ride across a lake. We spent a day here and we enjoyed spectacular views. Glad to have finally seen and experienced it.
